Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: sexysu
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 day trip to New York. This hotel is excellent value for money, although a budget hotel is clean and the staff (especially Jason on reception) are exceptionally polite and helpful, nothing to much trouble. Booked two twin rooms and when we arrived had two doubles, one very small. Mentioned to reception and was moved the next day to large twin room. If you want plush, luxury or flash hotel then book elsewhere and pay exorbitant prices. If you want value for money, cleanliness, unbeatable location and friendliness then book here. I certainly will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “New York City break”
Reviews.Author: Kininvie
Reviews.Content: Situated in the theatre district midway between Central Park and 42nd Street. The Amsterdam Court Hotel was in a very good location for exploring midtown Manhattan. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The room although small was very clean and adequate for the duraton of our stay. All in all, we thought is was good value for the money we paid and an ideal location for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: bmappus
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel without knowing name so was apprehensive after reading some of the reviews. Rooms very clean and everyone from housekeeping to front desk staff were very friendly and helpful.We had a room on the seventh floor that faced the back of the building so we heard no noise at night when we were sleeping.We would definetly book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: shopper2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with a friend of mine in January using the Groupon. The room isn't big but spacious enough for 2 people. However, what bothered me the most is the bathroom. It is really dated and small. The glass shelf in the our bathroom is broken so instead of fixing it, they used a scotch tape to 'tie' the 2 pieces together. It is definitely not a safe solution for the guests. In terms of food, the breakfast isn't something to rave about. But it is good enough if you just want to grab something quick. I highly recommend the Japanese sushi restaurant in the hotel. The food is delicious but a little on the pricy side. I would stay there again only if not needed to pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: weekender1973
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just around Times Square - very good location. You have half of Manhattens places to see in walking distance. + Location + Price + Breakfast (although a bit basic) - Windows (doesnt make a big difference if they're open or closed - it was noisy, cold and windy during our stay)

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravelalways21
Reviews.Content: First off, the locatin was perfect. Literally a few steps from Times Square. Room was a bit small, but that is to be expected in NYC. For what we used it for, it was good. We spent most of our time outdoors, not in the hotel. The staff were very helpful, even when we had credit card issues. The tub did not drain very well and took about an hour, which was kind of a pain when there is two people who need to shower and also there was no air conditioning. I would definately recommend this hotel for travellers just looking for a place to stay and not to worried about the amenities. Like I said, you cannot beat the location, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Stay”
Reviews.Author: madwitch47
Reviews.Content: Location - can't fault it. Just round the corner from Times Square. Staff - really friendly and helpful. Breakfast - not bad but basic. Hotel Room - basic, but clean. Maid serviced every day. The only thing I would say is if you get allocated Room 724, ask for a move straight away. The release valve for the central heating for the whole hotel is in this room and it fizzed and hissed all night long! However, the staff were great, moving us to another room straight away. Yes, it's noisy - but I haven't found anywhere in NY that isn't - so take some ear plugs! The hotel itself is a little dated and the mattresses had seen better days but if you are just looking for somewhere to sleep and use as a base, you'd been hard pushed to find anywhere better at the price. Don't expect 4 start standards and you shouldn't be disappointed. Would I use it again? Yes, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: 741GB19
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel expecting exactly what we got. A decent hotel providing a decent room to sleep in when not exploring the City of New York! Room was a good standard, I was bitten to bits by something but im sure it was not bedbugs as I found a mosquito type thing flying round our room the next day! Would recommend for people on a budget and not using their room much! Cant fault the staff, all of them were excellent and helpful when needed. Location was amazing just round the corner from Times Square and not far from other must sees!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to NYC a few weeks ago. I told Vanna at the front desk I was planning on proposing while I was there. She immediatly made every accomodation possible for us. From a beautiful room, to roses on the bed, desserts on the table and first class service, I couldn't have asked for anything more from the hotel. I will stay there everytime I go to NYC because of this trip. They made everything happen perfectly. Also the hotel was right across the street from the Gershwin where we saw the show "Wicked" which was by far the best show I have ever seen. It was also close to Times Square which made our travels so easy... Great location, great service, and great price. Overall, we loved the Amsterdam Court!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Also noisy, dingy, and old.”
Reviews.Author: KWatVermont
Reviews.Content: I stayed the AC Hotel for four days to attend a professional conference a few blocks away. I concur on everything other reviewers have said. I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you are only looking for a place to clean up and sleep very little. I am a petite woman and felt cramped even in the king room. the heat was either on or off, so I was either roasting or freezing. i chose to leave the heat off to prevent being woken up by the radiator noises and called for extra blankets. My room (#316), the 2nd room I'd looked at, had the following problems when I arrived: ~broken lamp ~broken outlets ~broken curtain ~broken door latch/lock ~loose, crooked bathroom fixtures, faucets ~chipped, scratched, stained furniture ~thin, frayed carpet ~bedding thin, threadbare Good: ~location ~friendly staff ~large flat-screen with local stations Bad: ~no heat/thermostat control (old steam radiators with no working valves) these also made noises constantly that would wake me up. ~very thin walls and noisy guests ~NO FREE WIFI, even at the "Business Center" ~poor bathroom lighting and no shelf space, even for one person They are renovating, so maybe I'll try this place again once it's done. but if they haven't updated the heating and soundproofed the walls then don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Hotel for those on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: sarah e
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly due to the location and the cost and on both counts this room delivered. On reading some of the reviews of this hotel we didnt really know what to expect as they are so varied but we were very pleasantly surprised! The location was fantastic, just a few minutes walk from Times Square and Broadway. Also an ideal location if you plan to use the subway which is just across the street . For the price we couldnt have asked for more as the way we looked at it was the less you spend on accomodation the more you have to spend on sightseeing and shopping! Yes the room was small but it is in the middle of the city so what else would you expect in a location like this without paying nothing short of a small fortune which is unecessary! For us we just needed a place to rest our heads and shower at the end of a very busy day in a very busy city! The room we had was on the 4th floor and was spotlessly clean and didnt seem any more outdated than any of the other inner city hotels i have stayed in all across the world! Also for the noise people complain about, it was also just the same as any other inner city hotel as not all guests are as considerate as we would like them to be. We didnt eat at the hotel because we were too busy in other parts of the city but the japanese restaurant was busy every evening and smelt absolutely delightful. As for the staff they couldnt have been more helpful! If your looking for a hotel right in the center of the city at a reasonable price, somewhere just to sleep and shower this hotel is fantastic and i look forward to staying here again in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms only average”
Reviews.Author: MKonholiday
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location and cost and on those counts it delivered. The first room we were checked into was on the ground floor next to a public toilet that seems to be used by patrons from the adjoining restaurant, was very noisy, cramped (no room for suitcases hardly) and the air con was too loud to have running at night. We asked to be moved and our second room was better with a little more room to move and a quieter air cond. The roof deack area of the hotel is an added bonus and we took takeaway food up there and ate which was much better than staying to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Done deal, this is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Alexad2
Reviews.Content: lets start off with how i got here way before check in...they ironed my clothes so i could hit the town versus waiting! seriously the best customer service i've ever had at a hotel, jason was soo helpful..he was basically our tour guide and very professional/welcoming as well. lets not talk about location, its right in the heart of where you want to stay~! the natsumi sushi restaurant which is next door is also superv, you can not leave ny without trying it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location - decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Vasanth1982
Reviews.Content: We had the Deluxe room with King-size bed. The whole room got filled with just the bed, pretty cramped. Breakfast was fine. Location was awesome. Just cant beat that. We had a groupon that we used for our stay, so it was a great deal we got for the location. View from room was bad though, but we did not expect much on that front anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jesseniarojas
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great!!! Times square is literally jus around the corner! And the subway/train station right next door. The ppl at reception are all very nice and helpful Especially Liza an Jason. The hotel is very affordable but The hallways could use some renovating. If I ever go to manhattan again I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Clerks”
Reviews.Author: Ed B
Reviews.Content: Karina and Natalie were very friendly and helpful. Making a stay the best. If I was going to vist NYC, it would definitely because of Katrina and Natalie. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaker101_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 days early in February. After reading some of the reviews, I was a little apprehensive about the quality of the hotel. However, my concerns were completely unncessary, as the hotel was a wonderful place to stay in Manhattan. The rooms are clean, comfortable and serviced daily. They are a little on the small side, but for the cost I paid ($90 per night including taxes), I was more than happy. The location is fantastic - Times Square is literally right around the corner (a 1 minute walk) and the blue and red metro lines are both located less than 20 metres from the hotel door. It is a great central spot where you are equal distance from downtown and uptown Manhattan. I also found the reception desk very helpful - they offered me a map when I arrived, took my bags to and from the taxi and were generally very pleasant to deal with. Two small issues: the heating in my room was a little inconsistent and I did have to place a call to reception to investigate the problem. However this was fixed within half and hour. The rooms also do not have wifi, however there is a Starbucks 1 block away with free wifi access. When I return to Manhattan, I will definitely stay at the Amsterdam Court. I could not justify spending any extra money on a more expensive hotel, when the Amsterdam Court provided a perfect base at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “heaven in the city”
Reviews.Author: LoryJA
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was nothing short of heaven. The staff was helpful, polite, and eager to please. Rooms were roomie, clean, and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maruchan_12
Reviews.Content: Great location and great value! I was there for business, and since location was great, I was able to visit around and do some sightseeing =)

Reviews.Title: “special birthday visit”
Reviews.Author: lottie70190832
Reviews.Content: my daughter took me here for a special birthday and it was brilliant the hotel was basic but very clean we wernt in the room long enough to compare as we walked till we dropped and when we did return in the early evening we were so shattered we just loved the bed the staff were nice and friendly also cant wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, but shows its age”
Reviews.Author: Albert S
Reviews.Content: The location was very convenient and in the heart of the theatre district. Linens and bathroom were very clean but the carpeting and general hotel appointments are showing their age and could do with a renovation. Rooms are small. Breakfast was included in the price and was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value!”
Reviews.Author: Ria_NEssex_UK
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for my birthday but when we checked the reviews we were concerned about what we would find. We need not have worried. Our room was great - clean, compact but big enough. Comfortable and great shower. We didn't have a view -looked out onto the internal atrium but this meant there was little noise from the New York Streets so we slept really well. The staff were helpful and polite and you can't beat the location. For location and value for money this was excellent. Just ask for a renovated room and you'll be fine. But pop along to Le Park Meridien hotel on 57th street and find the groovy burger bar behind the curtain in reception - its an event in itself. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing choice, I am coming back to this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cinloo82
Reviews.Content: I don't normally review hotels but this deserves my praise. The online photos do not do this place justice. The staff was more than friendly, accommodating and hospitable. The rooms were spacious (as far as NY hotels go) and clean. The location can't be beat. Walking distance from subway station, Times Square, and if you prefer a car service, they arrange that for you as well. My flight was late in the evening and they held my bags for me while I continued to enjoy the city prior to my departure. I cannot rave about them enough. Excellent place to stay. I am definitely retuning

Reviews.Title: “Great Reception, Need Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Mellisa V
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the first time, last week with my boyfriend for our 5 year anniversary and one thing that I can say is that it is not renovated; should be and will be. Which I was advised by the front desk that renovation is in process. Besides that nothing went wrong. I had a great room that the natalie accommodated us with our request of a view. She also helped us with reservations to restaurants like the nearby Empire steakhouse that i recommend to anyone that likes a steakhouse. as well as skip the line passes to empire statue building and top of the rock!! (ask for these!!) Karina was also helpful, she was very kind our entire stay with our many question since it was our first time in the city together. Housekeeping was of great service, we had service most night that we were there. Again... The only thing that this hotel need is to be renovated. Besides that I had a great time in New York. Will return soon. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Would *never* stay again.”
Reviews.Author: angie1967
Reviews.Content: As I'm on my phone, this will be fast. The AC hotel desparately needs $$$$ in renovations. We stayed 2 nights using a Groupon and were shocked at our "superior" room. The first night, our room was barely big enough to hold the bed and a fire escape blocked our 1 windows view... of an alley. The toilet ran non stop so we finally turned the water off ourselves, the tub could not drain (making showers disgusting), the pipes rattled powerfully while the water ran, and the shower head was broken so it felt like a fire hose was pounding the shower wall while a second hose blasted the curtain. Upon complaining the next am, we were put in a different room... a significantly better & nicer room. Turns out this second room was the kind we were supposed to get the first night. I cannot understand why we were given an inferior room, especially since I called 2x that morning to confirm our arrival. Our hopes for a better night were not met when the "superior" rooms' toilet flooded beyond the bathroom, and we were woken numerous times from hourly banging on pipes (faulty heat system???) and horn honking from the street SIX floors below. Obviously, this hotel needs new windows, plumbing, and other upgrades. I would NEVER recommend this hotel!!! You cannot and will not get a full nights sleep and you can expect an unpleasant experience with the restroom. At least we were close to the theaters but I felt like we were mistreated as we used Groupon reservations.

Reviews.Title: “My base for My New York Adventures”
Reviews.Author: 211DMK
Reviews.Content: New York City welcomed me with open arms, as did the the staff at the Amsterdam Court Hotel. The hotel is in midtown Manhattan, idealy located for places like Times Square, Port Authority, Rockafeller centre. Central Park and the Empire State Building are only a brisk twenty minute walk away. Transport links are amazing, and if you are coming in from Jamaica Centre , the E train stops on 50th Avenue/8th Literally 5 minutes walk from the Hotel, very handy if you have to catch an early flight back from JFK. The rooms are more than adequate for the price, and kept clean and well serviced. But lets face it you dont come to Manhattan to spend your time in a hotel room.There are plenty of really good bars and restaurants located near the hotel, be sure to ask at the front desk for recommendations. The staff are what really make the difference in this place, they are very friendly, very helpful and very welcoming. Jason on the front desk is the guy you really want to speak too, his sense of humour is only suppassed by his welcoming and approachable manner, without a doubt the best front desk guy I have ever meet on my travels. So thanks to everyone at the Amsterdam Court Hotel, if I ever make it back to NY I will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Liza is the BEST!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: d b
Reviews.Content: I just want to say the staff is very nice! Liza in particular at the front desk is very kind! You cant beat the location and the price! oh...the door guy is easy on the eyes too!

Reviews.Title: “excellant”
Reviews.Author: waynemario
Reviews.Content: my partner and i have just left the hotel after staying there for 4 nights,we arrived from london to the hotel and was greated with such a warm welcome,we have been to NYC at least 12 times and have never really had such a warm welcome as jason the recieption man had given us,we asked for a renovated room and he gave us one straight away,he also ask if we had been to NYC before and was going to give us some info on the city,places to eat and popaler places to visit,he said if we needed any thing we were to just ask,we got to our room to be very pleasantly supprised,to room was very modern and we had two big windows with air con and a very big bathroom with all modern touches,a wonderful walk in shower with modern wash basin and toilet,very clean there was so much space,the room itself was really comfatable,with a 36inch tv and modern bed spread with great lighting,and lots of plugs for electrics,it smelled very clean and fresh,and you could open the window with a safety catch,,the lift was always empty we never had to wait,the location was superb,it was so close to everything,right in time square but just a few blocks away from the loud noise so you can come out of the hotel and not feel to overwelmed the all the crouds,just minites from all the dinners site seeing places,as i said before we have stayed in NYC alot of times and this hotel was fanstic,we will be staying the again ,no question about that,there is also a lovely british london manager called vana ,who we meet on our last day,wish we had seen her earlier,she also was so lovely and would do any thing to make your stay comfertable,she was very professionable,and seemed to keep the hotel in tip top condition,it was so lovely seeing that. we just want to say a big thank you to all the lovely staff at the hotel for making our trip special,cant wait to see you soon,GOD BLESS, wayne mario xxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION FOR TIMES SQUARE VISITORS”
Reviews.Author: globetroterAustria
Reviews.Content: My girl-friend an I stayed 3 nights here January 6th 2012. I stayed here before in 1996 and decided to come again because the location and the price are good. The hotel was half empty and they gave us a real bad, small room. The reception clerk, a spanish speaking lady was very nice. I told her that I was also a concierge and member of the Clefs d'Or Austria ( The International Concierge Association). I said, we are going out for supper and when we come back I expect to get a better room, and I will reward you with a twenty bucks tip. It all worked out as I wished, got a nicer room, quiet with a larger bed and more space. We did not have breakfast there, too expensive for what they offer. There are so many nice Delis around where one can get a real good American or Continental breakfast. The best breakfast we had was at http://www.maisonnyc.com/ where we had lunch too. good quality, a little expensive. The rooms are clean but need to be renovated, especially the old fitted carpets. The staff was generally friendly except one other Spanish speaking lady who seemed to be the shift leader, she was a little arrogant we think.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: boweiwen
Reviews.Content: You can’t beat the location. Easy walking distance to theaters and Times Square. Our room was small and Spartan, but clean. The hotel had the heat cranked up too high. We had to turn off the radiator to cool things down enough to sleep. Otherwise, no complaints. A perfectly functional room for a Broadway weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staff”
Reviews.Author: JudyMoore082855
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend trip to New York City at the Amsterdam Court Hotel. First of all, the reviews I had looked at prior to the trip made me a little nervous-they were not very flattering to say the least. However, upon arrival, Karina at the front desk couldn't have been nicer. We had a Groupon promo, which included a king deluxe room, breakfast each morning & other perks. Our room was quite large for a midtown hotel with a king bed, adequate & clean bathroom & very comfy bed. We were very pleased! Everyone was so helpful the entire weekend-from the doormen to the cleaning person to the front desk personnel. Vana the manager was also very helpful & accommodating. The location is the best with many subways within a couple of blocks right in the heart of midtown. Parking at the Gershwin Theatre right across the street was reasonable as well. If I could say one disadvantage might be that next door there is construction of a new building going up & the pipes in our room were a little noisy, but, for a New York City hotel, that didn't bother us. I don't know what those other people were talking about in their unflattering reviews-the Amsterdam court is a great find & we will definitely be back in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: REssenson
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for great value for money! You can't beat the location, the staff were lovely and very helpful. The rooms are small but the bed was super comfortable and the bathroom very clean so what more do you really need?! My husband and I plan to stay at this hotel whenever we visit New York, we were very happy with our stay at the Amsterdam and look forward o our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “It's pros and it's cons”
Reviews.Author: E R
Reviews.Content: The hotel had presentation. It served it's purpose and was reasonably priced. Minus that gawd awful breakfast. I understand this is NYC and things are a bit pricey but overpriced crap is just outrageously ridiculous. Unpackaged danishes, orange juice and dry cereal for almost 11 bucks?? Not to mention, I served myself and the waiter showed up with the check in hand $10.xx #Offensive! The deli 30 feet from the hotel sells omelets, home fries and toast for FOUR BUCKS! - Moving on: The door guys are chatting away with the front desk and on their cell phone when they could be opening the door for people coming in from the rain. The cleaning lady with the red hair was sweet but could use a refresher on work mannerisms like not having an argument in the hall way where the guests can hear her. The tallest front desk guy tries to get an attitude and doesn't go the extra mile unlike Liza Ovalle! Liza is one of the only reasons why I would come back. Liza displayed quality in her performance and gave me first class customer service. Since the moment I arrived she knew me by name and was always very sweet and welcoming (so where the other girls). There was something that came up that I won't even get into because I'm not a complete a.h. - Without hesitation Liza took care of it. She is an asset to the hotel and I really hope she is recognized for setting herself apart from the rest in a positive way. I will be returning to the Amsterdam Court Hotel but only because Liza Ovalle works there and I know I can count on her to see that my accommodations are satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “JASON THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: DaDaDamn
Reviews.Content: no words for the bad reviews i red the reviews before i would arrive in new york and check in the hotel but i was very amazed of how bad and not satisfied people were but i am very very satsified while i stay in much more expensive hotels ITS PERFECT CAN NOT COMPLAIN GOOD SERVICE LOVELY STAFF LOCATION THE BEST !! JASON THANK YOU !!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but bad comfort”
Reviews.Author: A S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very good in theater zone but its rooms are not comfortable and cleaning services sometimes misses some rooms. The very best in that hotel was one of the girls in the reception, Liza Ovalle, she made us our stay there better; she recommended us some places very nice and helped us in every doubt we had. Thanks Liza!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: AJCC1
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel with an AMAZING location in Midtown's Theatre District. Just a few blocks away from the heart of Times Square, Rockafeller center and lots of shopping. Rockafeller center can be seen through the room windows. The staff is extremely friendly and are willing to accomodate your needs. The room was clean, the shower had a few stains and the water kept going from ice cold to scolding hot. That is my only complaint. Overall, it was a great experience. The rooms are not huge, but are comfortable. The subway station is literally 2 doors down and you have theatres across the street. It was my boyfriend's first time in NYC and he loved every aspect of it. I was having a tough time finding a reasonably priced hotel, and then I found this one in Groupon and decided to purchase it. BEST GROUPON EVER!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Boutique Hotel in NYC Theatre District”
Reviews.Author: SBU
Reviews.Content: Lovely little boutique hotel in the Theatre District. Some of the earlier reviews talked about how ‘small’ the room was. It worked for us. We had a king bed with room to walk on each side. Plasma TV. The place was very clean. There was a closet –while not very big, though it worked for us. The bathroom was recently renovated and had a large stand up shower –no tub, but no problem. Every one on staff went out their way to assist. It almost reminded me of the Apple Store culture—ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL. We went here on a Groupon that also came with Continental brkfast for two (nothing outrageous, croissants & cereals, yogurt & fruit) + Fresh coffee and tea always available 24/7; 4 Drinks at their sister hotel 5 blocks away. And all for $169 – ($200 including NYC hotel taxes)! Location is fabulous, as we came here to spend the night after having dinner near by & going to a Bwdway play (Porgy & Bess) which was 3 blocks away! The following day we went to a museum –again the location really helped. As we checked out, we got directions to pick up the uptown bus we would need to get to the museum, & Natalie at the front desk asked if we wanted to leave our overnight bag there until we were finished with our day trip. NICE touch. It also appears that everyone who works there is at least bi-lingual (English + another language). We live about 75 miles outside of Manhattan, and we have family living in Bklyn, so that while we usually do not need to spend the night in Manhattan this was a great mid-week romantic escape. Would we return here again? It is clean, reasonably priced, well managed + Location, Location, Location. -- Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations. Vana was very helpful and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Nbound72
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from a groupon getaway. Excellent deal. Would definitely stay again. Vana was a very helpful person.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: Jayda L
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in august and paid a low price for this hotel. It was a lot cheaper than other hotels. The room was pretty basic and the bed was a bit hard, but location of this hotel was one of the best bits. Not a very long walk to good locations. The rooms were a bit small but modern and we were happy with the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Big Groupon ripoff”
Reviews.Author: sbh1960
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on 1-7-2012 with my daughter and some friends. We booked through Groupon which stated we were booking a $300 hotel room for $179.00. This was my first time using Groupon after hearing such great things about it. I took it on faith that this was a good deal. I WAS DISGUSTED WITH THIS HOTEL!!!! We walked into my friends room and there was a HUGE chunk of blonde hair hanging room from the sprinkler on the wall. We went down to the front desk and they said there was no manager in the hotel. What kind of hotel in a major city does not have a manager on duty on a Saturday. What the ...... They assured us that the housekeeping manager would go right up there so we went out to explore the city. When we returned 3 hours later the hair was still there. On to my room. Although there was no hair decorations the heat just about killed us and there was no way to control the 200 year old radiator. I had the run the A/C at full blast and it was still too hot. There were sharp springs sticking out of the side of my mattress which we scratched ourselves on several times. Since there was no manager in the building at any time there seemed no point in complaining. The last straw was after the incredibly lame breakfast we returned to our room on the third floor and the maid was in the hall smoking butts. It smelled so bad and looked so incredibley tacky I was appalled that my 10 year old daughter had to see this. This was obviously a scam the hotel pulled through Groupon to cash in and it makes me sick that I spent my hard earned money on a weekend away that we rarely can afford on this DUMP. You do not have $300 rooms and the pictures on your website are ridiculous. Where are all these beautiful room. HIRE A MANAGER OR LEAST TELL THEM TO SHOW UP TO WORK!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Amanda G
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. The rooms were very small but updated. The workers were very kind and willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Super service”
Reviews.Author: Kurt A
Reviews.Content: Im from Denmark and i a wheelchair, so mu demands for a room is a bit more than usual. But the room in Amsterdam Cours is just super, Toilet is big so I can use the toilet and shower by my self without help. Room is as a normal hotel room, and OK. Super value for the money. You go out of the Hotel turn right for 100 metres and then you are in the middel of Time Square. Thats NICE. One thing this here little hotel have, and most dont is the SUPER nice, friendly and super helpsome staff. I must say the professionalism is outstanding, the help if you need something is good and fast. I have a puncture on my wheelchair, and within 30 min. Lize Oualle ran to the bike shop and got my wheel fixed. We needed a bit more warm on the room, and 1 min. after we said that there was a man fixinf the problem. THATS SERVICE. Thanks for a great stay, and we will choose you next time too. Big thanks for you kindness too Vana. Best Regards Kurt and Tina Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Yes we would”
Reviews.Author: david_bargas
Reviews.Content: We were greeted warmly upon arrival to the hotel from the door man. He was very helpful from the second we pulled up to the moment we left. Two smiling faces made us feel very welcomed as we checked in. The staff went above an beyond to help get us to the destination we wanted to see on our trip. Two young lady's that stand out as being especially helpful were Liza Ovalle an Natalie Garcia. Thanks I look forward to staying again at the Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a scam! Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: beaniecj
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival, an irate woman was at the front desk complaining about her reservation the hotel would not honor, which was booked through a third party company. This woman was with her young daughter very late at night. The front desk staff were not helpful, rude and inflexible. It was shocking that there was no manager on duty the week of new years in a times square hotel. They bullied the woman into booking a room for full price, regardless of the price she booked b/c they could not find her reservation in he system b/c she only booked it an hour ago. Fearful this would happen to us, it certainly did and to 5 people total that night. Our experience was shady at the least and an unsuccessful scam attempt because we watched and listened to every move. Our front desk attendant, Natalie Garcia, was the epitome of poor customer service at the mercy of her management to scam customers into paying full price for a room. We booked through booking.com. Natalie said they couldn't find the reservation in the system. About 30 minutes later, it appeared but the dates they had were incorrect ( one night off). I confirmed the correct dates shown in my Droid email confirmation. That should have stopped right here and we should have checked into our room. Then we had to wait while they called booking.com to discuss. Booking.com wanted to fax a correction but THE FAX WAS BROKEN! Booking.com then offered to email the new reservation to the hotel email. Natalie then provided her personal gmail account to receive the email. When questioned she didn't see anything wrong with this. she was aslo going to take another customers information home to fax to England bc the fax was broken! Are you kidding me! Natalie never did check her personal email and I started to smell identity theft. Natalie then offered us a "quoted" room for the original discounted price per her managers approval who was now taking calls at home. However we still had to deal with booking.com to cancel our original reservation. We declined thus quote and called booking.com and they told us the front desk needed to give an ok to cancel the reservation! We then dis ANOTHER go around of them now not being able to find us in the system when we were just up on the screen and they could not reference anything to give the ok to he woman on the phone. After pushing the new staff attendant, Chris, he miraculously found us in the system to cancel the reservation. What a nightmare! It's was like they were trained to use 3rd party reservations to scam for a full price hotel, not to mention Natalie who was sending info to her personal email....identity theft?

Reviews.Title: “Miserable”
Reviews.Author: Eileen B
Reviews.Content: We got to our room and realized that there were a few issues, but at the time they were bearable. The morning after our arrival I went to open the window to let the steam out (from all of us using the showers) and realized the window was NOT locked. In fact, there was NO way to lock it at all! The latch to lock the window was not functional because the air conditioner unit was sitting in the window, so the window could be opened freely from inside or outside. Once I opened the window, I could see it opened up into type of storage room. This room held extra materials such as carpet and tiles. It also had a steel door which appeared to exit into another part of the hotel. The hotel's solution was to give us all a free breakfast. We declined their breakfast and when we returned back from breakfast, we went to our room to make sure we hadn't forgotten anything and we looked one more time at the window. Apparently someone went into our room to not move our belongings to the new room, but to drive a screw into the window pane just above the window. This solution would prevent the window from being opened at all, so now not only does it not open, but if there was an emergency we wouldn't be able to open it to escape! Dana just made his hotel room even more dangerous! Other additional NON 3-star rating: the room was very small with very little room to maneuver; the door to the bathroom would not open all the way, as it would hit the bathroom sink and stop abruptly; a very small closet (more like a cabinet); we could hear lobby music all night long; only had 3 towels and took over 30 minutes to get more even though we were on the first floor; the shower head was faulty and would spray some of the water out of the shower and onto the floor; we ended up standing in a foot of water when showering because the tub didn't drain properly; the only other window in the room was in the shower that was about a foot back, five feet up, and only approx. 12" by 6" wide and offered little or no external lighting.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected of NY...Ughhhh..:-(”
Reviews.Author: Iam12travel
Reviews.Content: First time in NY did a over nite to see a band play .Im from DC/MD and our hotels at that rate are much better .......I stayed ..,, beds extremely hard and this was suppose to be a king supreme that's all you got was a king size bed an a desk with a old 19 in tv with the cable service messing up .....the bellman about 70 my friend had to go down an get out bags . Bathroom is the size of a linen closet .......if you like motel style of accommodations this is for you and I have seen better motels doing road trips

Reviews.Title: “Worse Experience EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Stacy C
Reviews.Content: Here is the NUMEROUS issues I experienced, while on vacation and stayed @ Amsterdam Court Hotel 226 West 50th Street, New York City, NY 10019: ~The hotel is under construction/being demolished so the building does not appear to be from the street; it's NY didn't know nor was informed it was The Amsterdam Court that was being demolished ~No ice, wine opener, cups, could be picked up or provided; The bell hop advised me that floors 2 and 6 had ice. There is no ice on floor 2 ~The blow dryer in my room didn't work, so I had to go out to dinner in 30 degree weather with wet hair ~Had an issue with the elevator that I would push #1 and the door wouldn't close ~The A/C, although not needed, was falling off the wall and held by duck tape ~The entire hotel was run down and severally smelled like smoke/cigarettes ~There was a plumbing pipe running through my room, that made banging noises every 10 minute lasting for 5+min (when ever someone went to the bathroom ~The shower water was either scolding hot or freezing cold ~Then after putting all the above aside to embrace my short stay in New York, I went with the flow and wanted to really enjoy this much needed vacation. ~The final straw was that not only could I not sleep all night due to the pipe, the banging, drilling, demolition was outside my BATHROOM WINDOW with 75+men workers screaming back and forth ~When showed other room options by the Manager, Liza, the rooms (by no exaggeration) looked like a prison cell or a death scene; bars outside the window, visualize a cockroach MOTEL ~At NO time on the website, from Groupon when booking my trip, nor when I checked in, did ONE person say that the hotel has not been renovated since 19?? and is now in the process of doing so, so please don't be alarmed ~The Manager, Dana and Liza (Liza did her best), did nothing other than offer me the "tax off my bill" and that "I had breakfast"; which consisted of toast and a banana!!! NO, that was/is not sufficient for me ~Asked for the Wi-Fi password so I could call Groupon(no listing in 411) or to book ANY other hotel, and after 32 attempts, I could not get the Wi-Fi to work, nor did my cell have a consistent reception signal. ~I then demanded that ANYONE (BEGGING) to please come to my room to get me an Wi-Fi connection; the IT Engineer could not get the Wi-Fi to work, nor could she stand the pounding and immediately left my room without resolution. ~Around 11am and 5 hours of banging, drilling, tractors, men screaming, and my room vibrating: I made my 12th and final call to the front desk to come get my luggage to store as I went to the Hilton around the corner for a "real" breakfast, the business room with access to a computer, fax, and had cell reception. Unfortunately, they were booked for the evening. ~ At this point I hadn't heard from Groupon for 3 hours, I finally had access to the Internet (Groupon's website), saw the "The Bentley Hotel" and that Groupon had a deal going with them (not the dates I'm here), but booked it immediately to try to accommodate Groupon. I trusted your Groupon and their suggested vendors/company and my trip was completely ruined :-(. I will never do business with Amsterdam Court...However, I have been extremely happy with The Bentley Hotel, yet have lost a huge amount of trust and credibility with Groupon and suggested vendors.

Reviews.Title: “Construction noise ruined our first peaceful night of vacation”
Reviews.Author: kelseyblahnik08
Reviews.Content: DO NOT PAY FOR BREAKFAST - it is a complete jip. It is basically juice, coffee, and packaged muffins. Absolutely not worth $10. Hotel staff, you need to warn people (at least once they have already booked and are about to try and get some rest at your hotel) that you have incredibly noisy construction next door. We were woken up by a jackhammer before 7am after looking forward to sleeping in on our vacations for the previous few weeks. We were furious that someone did not indicate that there would be construction right outside our window that early. If I would have known that I'm 100% sure I would have gone to bed earlier so that we could have rested up and enjoyed our time even more. The second night was not as bad because construction didn't start until 9am and that day there wasn't as much loud banging. We made the staff aware of these disturbances and they didn't seem to care at all! There is also something wrong with the shower we had - it goes from freezing cold to steaming hot back and forth. And something like a pipe or something on the window was broken in our room and it kept banging and waking us up throughout the night. The positives: The staff was decent. Not extraordinarily helpful but definitely friendly. It was a perfect location though!!!!!!!!! Right in the middle of everything. The sushi place attached (Natsumi) was spectacular!!! Also, the room was a good size - good bed and plenty of storage. The bathroom was obviously much older and a little worn down but clean. Unless we found a really crazy deal we probably won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but very convenient”
Reviews.Author: ledjan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amsterdam Court for 3 nights this holiday season. I looked at several reviews before checking in so I knew to ask for a room that had been updated. The hotel is old and there are parts of the hallways and outer walls that look pretty run down, however, our room was clean and in decent condition. We didn't expect to spend any time in our room other than sleeping and getting ready, so it was perfect. Very conveniently located and the service from the front desk to the maid to the bellman was excellent. We had a room with one queen bed that had plenty of room for two. Great big bathroom, but it did lack shelves for make-up or hair products if that matters to you. The restaurant and bar attached were packed every night, but the room was quiet. there was an incredibly loud construction project next door that began at 7:00 am. It's something to be aware of, but temporary and out of the hotel's control. As long as you are not looking for a luxury hotel, I would would both recommend the Amsterdam Court and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The best ever---”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this wonderful hotel during the holiday season. It stands out as a great option for a minima price with maximum comfort and service. The room was clean, bright, tv, kin bed nice bathroom with great pressure, quiet, and a responsive staff. No huge ammenities but what they had was superior--I would reccomend this for anyone who is in NY because of the location and practibility--absolutley will be back VERY soon!!

Reviews.Title: “was in the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: Katrina e
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed there last week for 2 nights we got a great groupon offer. when we got there they were really nice at the desk they upgraded our room to a deluxe which had lots of space, the room was clean but out dated. but the staff were amazing and so helpful

Reviews.Title: “Digital Camera was stolen! by cleaning staff!”
Reviews.Author: ジジ６９６９
Reviews.Content: No wi-fi, dark room, noisy neibors(Chinese refugee and hyspanic-)- My digital camera was stolen by the cleaning made, but the front woman staff hysterically tried to deny the fact, and call 911(Oh my god!) I definitely refuse choosing the 'agry' 'the refugee-stay'hotel in my lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “An Acceptable Thanksgiving Deal”
Reviews.Author: reh2os
Reviews.Content: I spent Thanksgiving weekend in New York for the first time this year. My relatives were already booked in more pricey rooms in the Times Square area as well as in a restaurant in the theater district for turkey dinner. So I restricted my hotel search to the same areas for convenience. That's why I chose Amsterdam Court on booking.com, based on my main criteria of location, price, and Trip Advisor reviews. I was assigned a room with a partial view of Broadway (nice!). I was pleased with the location and the price I paid for it (alright!). And the bed was comfortable and room fairly clean in general (perfect!). Unfortunately, everything else fell short. Space was quite tight and was exacerbated by the odd shape of the room; one corner of the room was blocked by the TV and the TV stand. It was also poorly lighted and the window A/C unit noisy. Breakfast and wifi were extra which I did not avail of. I was also surprised that bulky TV sets were still used in big city hotels like this one. I did not mind my situation too much because I had a packed itinerary and only used the room to come home to at night. After a 2-night stay, however, I decided I'd look elsewhere next time I come to visit this exciting city!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Good Location and Outdated”
Reviews.Author: The_Firestones
Reviews.Content: I booked here on a last minute business trip and landed a rate at just over $220 a night which is a great rate during the holiday season here in NYC. For comparison purposes other Times Square area hotels are in the $350-400/night range (Marriott, Sheraton, Hilton, etc.). There is construction next door where a new building is going up. My 1st room was 427 and on the side of the building where the construction is. Construction was on-going when I checked in and the jack-hammering was intense. I went downstairs and talked to Natalie about another room. She promptly moved me from a standard to a deluxe King bedroom without hesitation. The standard room was tight, but adequate. The deluxe King was more spacious relatively speaking. If you're used to Court Yard, Marriott, Hilton, etc. sized rooms you'll be disappointed, but remember they are 2 times the $$. The rooms, halls, stairs, windows, and air conditioners are all outdated. The wallpaper is dark, the carpet is worn in the halls, the lighting is dim, and the furniture is worn. The windows don't seal tight to keep noise out. It wouldn't matter anyways because the air-conditioning is an in-window type which means one of the windows is halfway open to accommodate the unit and the noise comes right in. (Hint: turn on the AC to Fan only and create some white-noise to block out the city if you need to) Just because it is a bit dark and worn doesn't mean that it is dirty. The place is clean, the rooms are comfortable, the bathroom is clean, has good water pressure and plenty of hot water. The iron works, the hair dryer works, the TV is fine and the bed is comfortable. Net-Net: Its a great little place for the price and location as long as you're not planning to spend a lot of time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Mandi3922
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in manhattan during our visit but didn't want to spend too much money on hotel so after checking around I came accross amsterdam court and decided to book here. The hotel was very good for the price we paid. It was quite a tiny room but we weren't planning on spending our time in the room! It has all the basic amenities you need, the heat wasn't the best as we travelled in early March when winter was now finishing (also we're from the Caribbean, where its alwasy warm) so we felt a bit cold at times. The restaurant downstairs had some good food, we only ate there once as we wanted to try lots of restaurants and "street food". Also the check in was quick and the staff were really friendly, they helped us with all our questions we had about moving around in NY. Overall I think this is a great hotel if you're just looking for a place to rest your stuff and take a little sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and Functional”
Reviews.Author: frankt.o
Reviews.Content: Good Service - Rooms were clean and functional, its NY city who stays in the room anyways!!! - awesome little bar in the lobby area - the hotel staff was very helpful with our questions. If you are looking for upscale modern rooms stay at the Hilton but if you are looking for a clean place to lay your head- this is the place. The location is awesome by the way !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Shower and Room experience”
Reviews.Author: tripsrusKitchener
Reviews.Content: The location is fine. There are plenty other hotels near or in Times Square to choose from that are much better. We checked in Wed night, went up to our room, and could only hear blaring music from the bar right below. Changed to new room there was no tv in there, so had to change a third time. This room wasn't any better, but I was so sick from moving around I thought we'll just stay. The room was really hot, no way to make it cooler. We had to open the window at night, which isn't advised in NYC. The reason the room is so hot is because hot water boiler is just below the room we were in (206). Taking a shower was a nightmare!! The hot water is scalding hot and we couldn't even touch the nobs. There was no way to get a good temperature...it was either scalding hot or freezing cold, never anything in between. We left it on for 20 min, tried adjusting the temperature using the sink taps at the same time, still no avail. The staff were accomodating enough. They weren't super nice, but would always help out when asked. Other downsides: You have to pay $10/day for wi-fi and $10/day for breakfast which consists of cereal, some pastries, coffee/tea. We just walked around the corner to the local deli instead. Bed was nice, cleaned everyday. That's about the only good thing. The bar downstairs was being renovated on during the day but open at night, and they served good drinks and service was good. We didn't try the sushi restaurant also attached. There were 8 in our group, so four other rooms and most had the same shower experience as us, but not quite as bad. Rooms were all the same size...small to fit a queen bed, one desk with t.v. and then washroom. That's it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but some issues”
Reviews.Author: gina g
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and location was great. The downside was the room was so hot, and I couldn't take a hot shower. It was freezing! Thank goodness we were only there for one night.

Reviews.Title: “amsterdam court review”
Reviews.Author: aldingo
Reviews.Content: new york is a must. my wife and i visited for my 50th birthday. we stayed at the amsterdam court hotel. the hotel is very dated, quite small but adequate. it is clean, the staff are efficient and friendly, if you like grandeur and splendour give this hotel a miss. i fell in love with its' small and homely feel. its location is superb, right on times square, and the rates, by new yorks standard are excellent. hope this is helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Broken beds, tiny, no lobby, SLOW internet!”
Reviews.Author: Steve M
Reviews.Content: This is far from the right place to stay in Manhattan! Walk past it to the far better and less risky hotels elsewhere in this area. It attempts to lure you in with its "boutique" name and mid tier pricing, but offers tiny rooms, brick wall views, and no "real" amenities, Our broken bed had us struggling not to gravitate to each other in the middle all night, and the constant plink of the old-fashioned steam radiator kept us from any kind of restful sleep, and with no way to control our room's temperature, we were quickly overheated and agitated. Scratchy sheets made for a horrible night in all. The internet here is as slow as it gets, with constant loss of connection and little reliability. Go elsewhere for this price, stay was worth half what we paid, or less.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: pvtruby
Reviews.Content: The room was very small. Not much more room than the bed, a dress, tv and the bathroom. Good thing we weren't in New York City to sleep. Right in the theater district. Wicked was playing directly across the street and it was an easy few block walk to Times Square. Right on the corner was a stop for the double decker tour bus as well as the subway. Great location and great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Convenient to everything!”
Reviews.Author: beeechgirl
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old daughter and I stayed here to celebrate her birthday in New York. The location was great. The front desk agents and the door men were very very nice and helpful. Very courteous even after my purse was stolen while I was in a stall in a Macys restroom and they took my hotel key, drivers license, credit cards, iphone etc. - the front desk lady was very kind and thoughtful to me. The room itself was very tiny with a tiny bathroom, window and a/c. But it served it's purpose. We didn't hang out in the room much at all except to sleep. Everything was clean.

Reviews.Title: “cheap but nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Lulupr81
Reviews.Content: I stay like 2 times, and they always clean, the rooms are small but good, is for sleep only you go to see the city and come back late to sleep, i really like it!! And everything is like walking distance!!! AAA++++

Reviews.Title: “Great location, standard and small room”
Reviews.Author: SocialJunkieee
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel was fantastic, 5 minute walk to times square! Close to a subway and stores. The hotel itself was undergoing some renovations but the room itself was very small with barely any room for suitcases. Would stay again it the price was still cheap.

Reviews.Title: “sleeper in great location”
Reviews.Author: STEVE O
Reviews.Content: nice sized room , great broadway location, pleasant staff, fair prices

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: br8ker2k
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay at the Amsterdam court,my hotel was sold out and I was lucky that there was rooms available here. Nathalie from the front desk was the most knowledgeable and smart person there. She made our stay very happy and always went the extra mile. Hotels should hire more people like her.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: blondie_pen
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in great location near times square- right in the hub of everything! stayed 5 nights here, but unfortunately we both had the flu! so as far as creature comforts went when we needed them most, this hotel was not comfortable! and the room was very small. However- fab location for seeing sights, then popping back to change as the weather did when we were there! Not the best hotel ive ever stayed in and wouldn't stay again. The bathroom was v.dated (80s pink tiles and bath with shower over and shower curtain, not screen) corridors smelt as poor ventilation and lift v.old fashioned!- seemed rather french-like than american! Quite noisy too. Plus points- free coffee/tea in breakfast room downstairs and reception staff v.helpful. Just watch for prices in hotel bar- about $19 for 2 drinks and a service charge on top for the barman who just poured the drinks and shoved them in our direction! Ideal if you are on a budget (although it was still fairy expensive even for that) and need somewhere in the heart of things.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: woodstock1323
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on 4th of July weekend through bookit. We were very happy with this hotel. The room looked like it had been recently updated. Yes, it was small, but that was expected. The lobby was nice, the staff was pleasant. Our bags were held since we arrived a little early and discounted parking was available. the room was very clean. We spend all day walking the city. When we returned the shower, the AC and the bedding felt like like the most wonderful thing ever. We slept great and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Virpilainen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great bargain! I was looking for a clean, safe place to stay in with a good location, and Amsterdam court was all that! You cannot book 3 stars and expect 5. This hotel was basic but clean and good! The standard rooms are tiny, but what else can you expect in NYC? Also you can hear everything behind the doors, which can be a bit disturbing at night. We stayed in August when it was really warm, so I also appreciated the small air conditioning device in the room. It was a bit strange/loud but did its job in a small room and sleeping was comfortable after running it for a while. As everyone else said, the location is perfect! Just a minute and you're in Times Square. I stayed with a friend and we both loved it and could not believe how good location and decent hotel we had found with such price. When I go back to New York, I will definitely consider Amsterdam Court again and I do recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location, staff are very helpful and kind ! Clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: AliberroSydney
Reviews.Content: 1 min walk and your in times square. You couldnt ask for a better location! The staff r amazing ! They helped us plan our stay in new York and advised us on everything we needed to know as it was our first time to new York, The staff were our personal tourist guidE, if it wasn't for the staff we would have been lost in the big apple ! Clean rooms, but more importantly the service I received was a clear 10/10 !

Reviews.Title: “We would not return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrustyTourist
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I arrived in New York, we walked past this hotel three times without finding it - then we realised it was hidden behind builders scaffolding and two huge builder's Skips. There was a renovation of the building next door underway, and throughout our stay the noise of Pneumatic tools was very loud and permeated the hotel. Our room on the sixth floor was supposed to have a view - and in fact it did have a view - of a brick wall and a Fire Escape ladder, all of which was covered in a grey 911 type debris. The bathroom was very old, dirty and dated, and the lifts in the hotel either didn't work or were extremely slow. The facade of the hotel was very 1950's ish, - drab and uninviting. When we asked Reception Staff to advise us where we could change currency, we were recommended to go to a Bureau with a hotel discount card, where we were offered a rate of $1.24 to the £ Sterling - which we declined. We then went to Macey's in house Bureau and were offered $1.59 without the need to produce identification - enough said. The location of the hotel was very good - only yards from Broadway, but the standard of this hotel dominated above all else, and my wife and I can only say to anyone thinking of booking in - don't, you will be very disappointed - pay a bit more, like we will next time, for something that looks and feels like a hotel. We hope this review proves to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: holidayers007
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location. Time Square was right at the end of the street and parking was directly across the road. The hotel is an Older style building but had been renovated inside. Our room was clean and furniture and bathroom seemed new. Staff were friendly and helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not good at all, so many issues, cockroach...oh no!”
Reviews.Author: olivesu
Reviews.Content: Cockroach was found in the bathroom; When I checked out, I was told no fee was charged. However I found that they actually charged me; The light couldn't be turned off in the night; The telephone is not working; The door keys couldn't open the door every single time, we had to go back to change them...etc

Reviews.Title: “great bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Doge31
Reviews.Content: you cant get a better location! right around the corner to Time Square, 3 blocks away from 5th av., next to the subway and there's a parking lot right in front! The price was affordable and the room was clean. its what you'd expect from a 3 star hotel.. we will definately stay again next time we come to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay, Great Location and very affordable”
Reviews.Author: rcringwall
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our 1 year anniversary and it was such a nice place to stay. The hotel was very clean and our hotel room was very nice. I had read a couple reviews on the hotel that some of the rooms could be small. So after I booked the hotel using an online travel site I immediately called the hotel to make sure that they had me in their computer and then I asked if I was staying in one of their small rooms and I guess I was becasue then the woman on the phone was very nice and asked if I would liked to be upgraded to a room on an upper level and then she upgraded us for free. I really didn't know what to expect when I got there but the place was very nice.. very clean and NO bed bugs. The hotel is within walking distance from everything.. it is right across the street from the broadway show Wicked. We were right there by time square which made for easy access to the Grey Line hop on hop off bus tours. We walked to central park and rockafeller center. Perfect hotel for the price in a great location.. I would absolutly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Not so great room/ hotel ....”
Reviews.Author: Keely0207
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault the location of this hotel - within 2 mins walking you are in Times Square. So perfect if you are not going to be using the hotel room very often. The hotel reception is a bit deceiving to the rest of the hotel. The Reception looks new and modern.... But the hotel rooms are far from that. The pictures on websites really are deceiving. There was one lift in operation whilst we was there, which was slow and we waited ages for it each time we wanted to get to our room. We were awoken most nights by the loud traffic passing outside our room. The room was clean..... But ODD! Cant seem to describe what it was, but definetly not what i expected at all. The shower didnt work... each time we used it, it flooded the entire bathroom. The sink taps wouldnt turn completely off. This hotel is ideal, if you just wish to use it for basics!!

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what was advertised”
Reviews.Author: Aewiltsie
Reviews.Content: Amseterdam court is not worth the money. Location was good, but room was not clean, bathroom was not clean and beds were harder than a futon. Pictures are very deceiving.

Reviews.Title: “Very roomy...outside of the hotel. They gave away our room!”
Reviews.Author: Nancys_Man
Reviews.Content: While reading the other reviews online today, I noticed so many accolades about the friendly "service" at this hotel. Well, of course! The staff at this hotel spends all day calming the guests down while shuffling them to different rooms. We had booked and PAID for our room over a month in advance after finding it through bookit.com as a "Mystery Hotel". On the day of our arrival from Canada we called the hotel to let them know we'd be arriving late due to the train schedule. "No problem" replied the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel 10:30pm, imagine our delight when the front desk lady told us they had no rooms available!!! They said they could pay for a cab to take us to a nearby hotel. After my wife hit the ceiling, they "found" another smaller room to put us in. You could barely get the door open to find a twin bed. And no...they weren't kidding. Being that this was part of our first anniversary, I got to see my bride transform into someone that would make the Alien jump off the ship. In NYC they CAN hear you scream! Guess what? They somehow "found" a larger room for us that night and promised to get us into an even larger room the next day. They also comped our continental breakfast in the morning (paying $10 each for toast, cereal and some fruit seemed a ripoff anyway). The larger room proved to be bearable, but don't try to pass each other by the side of the bed. It ain't happening. The bathrooms don't have vent fans, so use caution if you enjoy Mexican food. The location of the hotel was the best part of it all. The subway was nearby and you could walk to just about anywhere (Central Park, United Nations, Rockefeller Center, Empire State, etc). Other than seeing $30 Reuben sandwiches on the menu at Roxy's, the New York City experience itself was enjoyable and memorable. It's great to get back to Florida beaches and roomy accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price for the location.”
Reviews.Author: RichnLee
Reviews.Content: The location to Times square was excellent, the staff at the hotel were excellent. Our first morning there we awoke to drilling/banging from the building site next door. This started at approx 0700. When speaking to the hotel staff they were surpirsed by the builiding works and had no knowledge of them happening, which on the face of it seemed a little strange as the building had obviously been in the demotiliton stages for weeks/months. The lady on reception who I cannot remember her name was very helpful and arranged for us to be moved to a quieter room. This happened with no fuss and I am glad we did complain. we got a quieter, bigger, cleaner room. The room was not made up for 2 nights though, am unsure why? And the room did get hot, the air conditioning was very noisy. There were 2 lifts, 1 worked and was very slow due to the high volume of traffic. We were told at reception that the out of order lift was a recent event and would be fixed by the end of the day. On speaking to other staff members the lift had been out of action for 6 months, and the lift still wasnt working when we left (after a 4 night stay). You could see the hotel is run down and is in the process of having works done to improve. As I say, great location, friendly and helpful staff. At a push I would stay there again but there would need to be improvements. I should have known though by the price. You really do get what you pay for. There was a happy hour in the bar which we didnt try due to it being busy, there is also a japanese restaurant attached which again was also always busy. There is parking across the road in the parking garage of the gershin theatre, you get a huge discount for this. But to be honest the location of this hotel so close to subwa etc i would never bother with a car.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good...”
Reviews.Author: timjstl7
Reviews.Content: Great location and relatively inexpensive, but the room and bed were tiny, the main elevator didn't work and my bed was missing its headboard. The window a/c unit made the room a bit smelly, as well. The room was only 9' x 10' (not including the small bathroom) and the bed was so small my feet hung off the end of it (I'm 6'1"). The room had no furniture and only had a small TV mounted to the wall. It was a far cry from the picture on their website. The staff was friendly enough and my interior room was quiet in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: ZuluTwo
Reviews.Content: Location was great. Staff friendly. Hotel mediocre,rooms small but clean. Peter.

Reviews.Title: “what are you looking for?”
Reviews.Author: EKT40
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our anniv. trip to NYC, first time to the Big Apple...this hotel was not a disappointment. I have read all the bad reviews and was not sure what to expect when we got there. First they upgraded our room (we had a bigger one so call ahead and ask for a bigger room - as some are small) and we were facing the street. The hotel is old, but if you know anything about NYC there are way more older buildings than new ones. The bed was comfortable (but I could of slept standing up I was so tired)...but the bed was CLEAN, all white sheets and comforter, bed pad on the bed. not bad! The hotel itself is clean, the furniture is ok, worn mildly but ok. What I mean by worn - the table may have had a few scratches etc. The bathroom is small but what do you need a huge one for? I saw the pics of the tubs (where they looked dirty) they are cast iron, this is where the paint has worn over the years....like I said old building, old hotel. But it was clean and always had plush white clean towels. The front desk is most helpful, and we checked our bags (got there before the room was ready) and hit the town...For what we gave, I was most pleased! Next, LOCATION!!!! Walk just around the corner and you are in the heart of Times Square!! Go to your left or right and you are at the subway, this location is hard to beat!!!! Oh, I recommend E-Z deli for a quick sandwich, as the food was wonderful! Come on people - its a room where you are gonna shower, shave and sleep, its the Big Apple, if you are hanging in your room checking out the decor, you need a life anyway.. Don't be afraid of this hotel, we were pleased! Planning a trip back with the kids and will stay there again! :) thanks Amsterdam Ct.!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Cswlive
Reviews.Content: Before going to New York I checked out some of the reviews on this hotel and to be honest I was a bit unsure of what to expect however when I got there I was reassured! It's in the perfect location, close to everything and in the heart of times sq. The room was clean, modern and the perfect size. The staff were helpful and very friendly. However the room was quite hot and the lift was slow. The maid service was ok but room for improvement as our room was not cleaned for 2 days and had to ask for clean towels. However would consider staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value...even better location!!!”
Reviews.Author: lounug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just back from a 5 night trip to NYC and stayed in Amsterdam Court......We would definitely stay here again. Great value so more spending money for the NYC attractions. The staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The location is excellent, right in the heart of everything but we had no problems with noise. We were in a smoking room and it was decent size and bed was comfy and air con was a life saver as it was 25c-30c degrees while we were there. Bathroom was a good size and clean. Downsides would be....it would've been nice to have a fridge/kettle facilities. The room could've down with a bit of updating ie. the windows were a bit shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended - very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaT13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as a celebration of our Ruby Wedding Anniversary (40 years) and was disappointed with it. Situation is perfect to be right near theatres and Times Square, just 5 minutes walk away. The hotel itself needs a lot of TLC as it is very drab and dated - all decorated in dull mode (dark brown carpets and dull cream walls) Room was very small and if you want to take a bath then you need be no taller than about 1.5 meters! Air conditioning VERY noisy! Only one person can walk past the end of the bed between the wardrobe! 2 lifts in place but only 1 working, the lift working is very slow and it is quicker to walk up the dingy stairs if you are able. On the outside of the hotel scaffolding is in place due to redevelopment of the district and will stay in place until at least 2012 (per notice attached to the scaffolding!). In its favour, our towels were changed daily and the bedding was changed during our 6 day stay. As long as you only use the hotel to sleep and wash then it is not so bad. Would not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not so good rooms....”
Reviews.Author: TravellerTwo_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a week, in May 2011, and I have to admit that the location is perfect. Just near Times Square (2 minutes walking) and in a not too big building. There were works in progress in the façade of the building, but that was ok. The staff at the Reception was nice and professional, although the lady at the desk could be a little friendlier. A smile would be nice, but she was efficient. The lobby, the restaurant and the bar are very good, but the rooms need a complete refurbishment, because they are very dated. They are comfy, but too small for the price we pay. Once it rained outside, and there were some (few) drops falling from the ceiling. The phone went dead in the middle of an important local phone call and it stayed like that for quite a while. I had to wait until I got some signal on the line and then I called the Reception. They said they couldn’t help me, but then I was able to redial and finish my conversation. There was no charge for these 2 phone calls on my bill, so it was not that bad. It is a really good place to stay if you just use the room to sleep and take a shower, as we did, but don’t expect much more. In the end, it was a quite pleasant stay, even if the rooms need urgent attention. I wouldn’t mind going back there, again….

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Amsterdam Court Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JHaring
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend in November. The front desk employees were wonderful and very helpful. It is close to the subway, walking distance to the theaters and times square. I wanted to stay there on my upcoming trip (tomorrow), but the room had gone up and I was on a one night trip. My next trip will be planned in advance, and I will stay there again. I really don't understand the bad reviews!

Reviews.Title: “nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Voyager01
Reviews.Content: Would you sleep in a room with hairs on the bed covers. rugs so dirty and torn that the maid changing the bed covers didn't want to place the blankets on floor. Fortunately manager Robert Grippo cancelled the rest of the reservation. They should not rent these rooms at all. I'm wondering if what qualifies as a health hazard in hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Lisburn11
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but spotless. The location could not have been better, literally just minutes to Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “horrible!”
Reviews.Author: fiz555
Reviews.Content: Besides the convenient location (walking distance from Broadway), this was one of the poorest hotels i have ever had the displeasure of staying in. room was very small and outdated by several decades. We've stayed in new york on several occasions and our expectations were healthy and somewhat positive. All that changed as soon as we entered our dark and claustrophobic room. not only was it outdated it was also poorly maintained and dirty. Rusty bath tubs, exposed pipes in the bathroom and bedroom alike, boarded up window with zero natural light, and a previously used unclean bathroom are few of the several things that made it unbearable to spend another minute in this room. we had to call house keeping several times before the bathroom was cleaned. we finally couldn't bear the thought of spending the night in the room and called concierge where they eventually moved us to a better room. We will not go back to this hotel and hope we can help others from making the same expensive mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hate2stayhome
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we were hesitant to stay here. We traveled with friends. Everything you are reading about slow elevators is correct, but being one block off of Broadway and a 5 minute walk to Times Square was fantastic. We went to see Lion King and walked both directions (maybe 10 minutes each way). We were upgraded to a very large room. The bathroom was small, the tile and tub old and dingy, the mirror cracked... but it was better than average for New York City. The bed was very comfortable. The window in the bathroom (which led to a dark empty spot between buildings) didn't lock. The heat worked so well that we had to turn on the Air Conditioner or open windows at times to not be too warm. The room our friends stayed in was smaller.
