They mentioned finding some mold in the bathroom, and that the positioning of the light fixtures made the "desk" area dark. They seemed to feel replacing some burned out bulbs would help. They also ran the AC to keep from being too warm. Erin and Covina at the front desk were very helpful and delightful. They assisted with recommendations for places to eat and directions. The biggest inconvenience was the slow elevator and the fact that one is out of service. We ended up walking the stairs (Our rooms were on the 4th and 5th floors) several times. Suggestions for the hotel: Fix the Elevators, Fix the locks on the windows. Install safes in the rooms, Give Erin and Covina a raise.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Carriecas
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting a five-star hotel, book a room at the ritz. But for what I paid, this place is value central. I booked for 170/night on hotels.com--practically the price of a hostel! Yes, the room is small, but with everything the city has to offer, what the heck are you doing hanging out in your hotel room? If you're looking for good value and good location, look no further. If you're looking for luxury, be prepared to spend a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Court Jesters”
Reviews.Author: leaferONT
Reviews.Content: The location was great, the room was small but okay. The management was laughable. I booked a room for five nights, four months in advance and paid up front. With that you might think they would give us a room in a nice location. Instead we were situated right next to a room undergoing loud construction. We asked for a different one and they said no others were available until the following day and said that the construction only went on between 8:30 am and 4:00 pm - as if that was okay! The following day they offered us a room on the main floor which was even noisier than being next to the construction. Two nights later we got in at 10:30 pm and construction was going on next door. I called down 3 times with promises that it would soon stop - this went on until midnight when they told it me it would finish at 12:30 - as if that's okay! The phones were out the entire time which made it awkward to call and meet up with friends in New York. This place needs a management overhaul but the location is great and if the management was considerate of patrons, I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but horrible experience otherwise”
Reviews.Author: 80sgirlHighPoint_NC
Reviews.Content: Came to the city for the first time. I was very excited to see that the location of the hotel couldn't be beat. The outside did not look like the photos and it was covered in scaffolding with just a banner to show you the name but I was hopeful. I expected a relatively small room but this was ridiculous. I could almost touch both walls with my arms out. There was a window facing the street which was great for the view but it didn't close all the way or lock (I was on the fifth floor) so I had street noise at all times of the day & night. The bed was so hard and uncomfortable I even checked to see if I was sleeping directly on a box spring. There was an ice bucket but no ice machine and no room service. There was a brunch buffet but it looked terrible and cost $10, nothing complimentary here. The room was WAY too hot but with the window open anyway it was bearable. Tiny bathroom, halls, elevator, in fact everything was too small. The bathroom didn't even have a showerhead just a pipe that the water sprayed from. The girl at the desk was very nice and answered any questions I had and I was allowed to check in earlier than the time listed but that is all I got from this stay. Most of the rest of the staff didn't seem to speak English and COULDN'T answer what I asked. It turned my exciting, dreamed of, first trip to New York into a nightmare. I even changed my flight and went home early. At least there were no bed bugs. I WILL NOT be back.

Reviews.Title: “JUST SAY NO!!!! I'M TRYING TO SAVE YOU!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTraveler318
Reviews.Content: This was by far the most shocking hotel experience I have ever encountered!! The ice machine didn't work, the air conditioner didn't work, the elevator didn't work, the bathroom light didn't work, the TV didn't work, the sink drain didn't work and the smoke alarm didn't work(the dead batteries caused it to beep all night)!! It was comically terrible! If you don't have a sense of humor when it comes to paying $200/night for the worst accomodations in the city then DON'T STAY HERE!!! It was SHOCKING!!! I am 5'6" (average height) and I could literally lay on the bed and reach the far wall with my hand and the door with my feet (we have pictures to prove it). The room was about 8 feet across and allowed only room for the bed (which was falling apart, sagged on the left and didn't even have a fitted sheet!) and space for the door to open! IT WAS OUT OF THIS WORLD!! Even the repair man that visited our room several times LAUGHED AT THE SIZE OF THE ROOM!!! This is not the place to stay when you visit this fabulous city!! Please don't make the same mistake I did!!! There are other places to stay!!! PLLEEEASE DON'T DO IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Wants to be a posh hotel - but it really isn't and never will be”
Reviews.Author: ngates85
Reviews.Content: Great location - I paced the steps from the hotel to Broadway - 106 steps! No need to taxi's and at only £100 a night a real bargain. Having said that, the hotel was not great. Initially we were put in a standard room that was extremely noisy from a neighbouring building (banging of an air con unit or something?) and the TV did not work (all though that's not an issue). The windows were single glazed therefore noise was not blocked with window shut and as the room was tiny the bed was next to the window. Modern room although the bathroom was dated. I complained about the noisy and after a bit of sarcasm from the receptionist she upgraded us to the supreme room which was on the street, alot quieter and bigger room and bed. Bathroom was disgusting, bath was black with dirt (pic uploaded) and also dated. Bed was comfy though. The hotel appears to be renovated and wants to be posh, but it really isn't. The breakfast room looked shocking and at $9.95 for bakery products we gave that a miss. I would only recommend this hotel if you plan to be out of it more than in it - purely for the location. Try the Trattoria Trecolori restaurant for a nice Italian meal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Scrat59
Reviews.Content: The room was at the second floor and really tiny for 4; beds and bathroom were comfortable, zero view from the window, no noise from the street. The elevator was often out of use. We were in the heart of Manhattan. Subways just a few meters, same for Time Square. You don't need taxis but only Metrocard. They have a luggage deposit and only ask for a tip. I will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “good value , excellent location”
Reviews.Author: paisano42
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights under special deal for fashion week $75 + tax = about $90 per night. Very modest room, with little space for anything but sleeping in the (somewhat saggy) queen bed. Odd furnishing arrangement with TV in logical closet niche and coat rack right over table, only 1 chair . Decent bath, lots of towels. Friendly, helpful staff. Justifiably popular japanese restaurant adjoining Stones throw from Broadway, 2 subway lines within ablock. Hard to beat for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, spacious, no bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: JesseL4
Reviews.Content: I did my research and luckily, this place surpassed all expectations! It's affordable, in a convenient location, and it's the only affordable place I could find in NY with no mention on the Internet of bedbugs. I stayed with a friend and our room had 2 double beds and a bathroom in the room and it wasn't CRAMPED and TINY like most places in Manhattan! Slow elevator but the stairs worked fine. Highly recommended for travelers on a budget who are sick of hostels and concerned about bedbugs!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't beat the friendly staff and the excellent location, but rooms left a lot to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: reeselizabeth
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were able to check in about an hour early with no trouble. The room was small, however that is to be expected in Manhatten. We were first struck with the strong smell of soap and bleach in the room, we had to open the window to thin it. Also, the shower in the bathroom leaked and when we took a shower the hot water pipes made an awful noise. My only other complaint was the lack of sound proofing. I was woken several times during the night when neighboring doors were slammed shut. Other than the slamming doors the hotel was very quiet and respectful. The maid service was excellent and the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Also the location can't be beat. It was on the same block as the metro that led straight to Penn Station and right around the corner from Times Square. It's also within walking distance of Rockefeller Plaza and the MoMA. Also, no bedbugs came home with us! For the price we paid, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central and inexpensive hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: mango_eater
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. While the rooms are rather small, the decor is modern with a soothing color scheme of beige and brown. The sheets were soft cotton with a duvet. Some toiletries were provided. Wicked was playing across the street, David Letterman was around the corner, Rockefellar center was about three blocks away. I would highly recommend this hotel. Make sure to check out Eataly-- if you like Italian food this is the place to go!!! Excellent gelato

Reviews.Title: “Lying thieving con artists”
Reviews.Author: Kushatirwa
Reviews.Content: I had to change my reservation due to my flight being cancelled because of adverse weather conditions in London. I spoke to the reservations and was told there would be no additional costs to change the dates of my stay. They even sent me en e-mail confirming this. Two days later they said I had to pay GBP160.00 to change the dates and when I questioned the e-mail in my receipt I was told there were no rooms available!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed. Good location but grotty”
Reviews.Author: FayetteBolton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mother for two nights on a shopping and sighseeing trip. Great location: you cannot fault it. Near to Times Square, the Broadway theatres and subway links. We arrived mid afternoon and we were informed at the desk that we would be upgraded to have two doubles in the room as I was clearly travelling with my mother. A result, I thought, until we got to the room. In room 715, we were on the 7th floor right next to the lift shaft. It was noisy. The room did have two doubles in it but it was very small. No problem really but the furniture was very tired, bedside tables had paint peeling off them and the radiator/heater was all discoloured and mouldy. The bathroom was spotlessly clean, if a bit dated in a 1960s style. The window looked out over other rooftops. I did not expect a luxury room but we felt we could not properly relax. Even my 5'4'' mother found the beds too short, we both had to sleep diagonally. Check out was troublesome, I stood there for ages: the receptionist was too busy showing a Spanish tourist the sites of Central Park on a map to check me out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: cri04
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the afternoon and they gave us a room which was so small (and old and depressing, and there was only 1 tiny window and no light orfresh air coming into the room!!) that could not be defined a room really. we complained, they move us to another room ( a little bigger, a little less depressing): the window frames were so bad that a cold wind came into the room even if the heater was at full speed. We complain again, they give us another room (same size but more depressing) - after a while w realize that that one also has the same window frame probs, we complain again and decide to upgrade to a suite for an extra 60 usd: ahahaha and they call it a suite!!! room was actually ok quite old but good size and no windows problems. the bathroom (like all other bathrooms in the rooms we visited that day) was very old (60ies style, pink tiles etc) and the shower was not working - only boiling water coming out: they fixed it the following day. after 2 days it was broken again (this time only cold water coming out)!!! We complained very harshly, but they could not care less, what we got was a 50 usd per night reduction - BUT THE POINT IS: SINCE WE PAID A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF MONEY CAN WE AT LEAST HAVE A DECENT SHOWER WHICH IS A SERVICE THAT PRESUMABLY ALL HOTELS EVEN POOR CATEGORY SHOULD PROVIDE???? Please also note that the lobby is very nice and modern and it is actually set between very good japanese restaurant and a cool bar - both of which do not belong to the hotel, you will find out!!! ahahah As soon as you go up 1 floor the rooms are very old and depressing + note that the hotel has no facilities: no mini bar, no bar, no restaurant or room service, NOTHING: if you open the booklet that you find in the room they suggest that you order a pizza take away from some nearby place: how sad is this?? Please please please avoid this place - go somewhere else where you can actually relax and enjoy your stay (and a decent shower)

Reviews.Title: “Too many things didn't work”
Reviews.Author: 40states30countries
Reviews.Content: Here is what didn't work at various times during the 2 nights I was at this hotel: the toilet- I had to yell at the engineer to go fix it the heat (it was 23 degrees outside). They put a space heater in my room the second night the hot water- whole building went out Here are the standard hotel amenities I requested that they didn't have: a sewing kit a luggage rack I know it's New York, but more than $250 a night (including tax) is a lot for a room like this with a king bed and small television and nothing else. Air shaft view. The mid-town location is excellent. I didn't go there, but the sushi bar looked crowded and a NY friend told me the bar was popular.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: sincitytraveler_10
Reviews.Content: Pretty good deal for the money & great location near subways, short walks to main attractions - Times Square, Rockefeller Center... A little noisy, some hummming now and then but overall a nice experience. Take some PM meds with you just in case the taxi horns keep you up! Stayed in Room 518 - wasn't smelly, didn't face brick wall, had opening windows, radiator worked really well, has a/c, tv worked - and the elevator worked on our trip as well :)

Reviews.Title: “Used to Better”
Reviews.Author: travella0611
Reviews.Content: I stay in the area every year with my teenage daughter for Thankgiving Day Parade and shopping/plays. I wanted to save money and have more to spend on fun but the money I saved was not worth the suffering of the room we stayed in. There was construction outside my window every morning...difficult to control water temp in a bathroom built for a midget , very old ....very small room..remote not working...not enough light...no counter space...very slow elevators....no amenities....took 55 minutes to get busboy to take down luggage from room on checkout....will never go back even if it was FREE

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nothing else”
Reviews.Author: WACKI_10
Reviews.Content: We arrived, couldnt check in at 3 pm, came back at 3.30 as requested, still couldnt check in....staff were ignorant , room was dated, chipped bath, desperate need of a refurb, then we were overcharged - breakfast was quoted in the rate we'd been given but my card was charged for it - and for breakfast with plastic cups and paper plates...havent stayed in anywhere quite as bad for 20 years...but its a great location.

Reviews.Title: “very good location but disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: ednale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 6 nights. Very good location, we could rest for a while every afternoon. The staff at the front desk was very kind and helpful. The TV was out of order but they repair it very soon, after our complain.The room and the bath were clean, but the room was old and sometimes depressing. The air condition made a terrible noise, so we had to stop it for sleeping. There is a little lobby with a free coffee/tea and a nice breakfast for 10$ each. So we decided to enjoy our time in New York and not to criticize the hotel ,it's good enough for 185$.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain awful”
Reviews.Author: fayth143
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in had a bunch of problems in and of itself. Some buttons on the tv remote didn't work, the room faced a brick wall, the air was stagnant and reeked of cigarettes, the AC didn't work, the sheets were dirty (no lie - there was red lipstick on the sheet - ewww), and not to mention that the elevator was broken, so I had to walk up and down 7 flights multiple times. FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: mrswhitt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed over the weekend at the Amsterdam Court Hotel and could not be more pleased with our stay. I had read a lot of the reviews when booking, so I was a little concerned with cleanliness and size of the rooms. I couldn't have been happier. The location is the absolute best part about this hotel. It is right on Broadway just around the corner from Times Square, and extremly close to Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center and pretty much everything else. Upon check in, the staff was incredibly helpful and nice. Our room was surprisingly roomy. Based upon the reviews, I expected a bed and little walking room around it. Nope, there was plenty of space...although they did give us a corner room, so maybe that had something to do with it. The room was extremely clean and updated. The bathroom was also clean and a decent size for NYC. The bed was extremely comfortable...even my husband slept great. Overall, this is a great hotel! I highly recommend staying here as we definitely will in trips to come.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get the "bad" reviews.....”
Reviews.Author: 20Paws
Reviews.Content: Service was great. Staff was helpful in every way. Hotel was clean. Close to a lot of great places. Got a corner room and the only pitfall was it was on the street with the sign flopping in the breeze which made a noise, but, I got use to it. Room was plenty big. Bathroom was small and dated. Price that I got was expensive for the type of hotel and room, but it was in a great area. I really enjoyed staying there and would again if I could afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: RobinSue
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel listed as a "3 star mystery hotel near Times Square" throught Book-It and took a chance. It turned out to be a lovely, low key place in a terrific location very close to the theatre district and several subway lines. The double bedded room was small but clean, with a nice bathroom. There is free coffee/tea 24/7 and the front desk staff were friendly,courteous and helpful. We paid about $140 per night including taxes and it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: DianeP49
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the heart of the theatre district. In fact, the Gershwin Theatre is right across the street, now showing Wicked. Diagonally across from the Winter Garden Theatre now showing Mamma Mia! All of Times Square is just around the corner, and it's a short walk to the Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall in one direction, and to the Empire State Building in the other. It's also very close to the greenline subway to China Town, Lilttle Italy, Soho and Greenwich Village. The hotel lobby is framed by their two restaurants. We never dined there because there were so many great options in our :neighborhood. The rooms are small and very old. They are reasonably clean and we foudn they were fine for our needs--a bed to sleep in at night! They don't offer free wi-fi which is unusual in this day and age; they have it available for $10 a day. The rooms don't have coffee pots, but they do offer free coffee downstairs every morning. They also don't have microwaves or refrigerators, which didn't really matter to us on this trip. We wanted an extra blanket and room service brought it up right away. There is no official concierge, but the front desk staff was also very helpful in pointing us in the right direction as we headed out daily. The price was sure right. We paid less t han $200 a night, which is hard to find in NYC (unless you stay in a real dump). I was there for a conference at the Javitts Center. It was too far to walk sclepping all my junk, but it was a quick cab ride, about $7 each way. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelBack1
Reviews.Content: This has a great location, friendly staff, and clean room. The only thing I did not like was that the room was the smallest hotel room I have stayed at in New York. In spite of that, I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfy room in a great location 5mins from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: MrsHutchy06
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked by my parents who have previously stayed at the hotel. Having read some of the reviews I was concerned about the room, cleanliness and building work detailed. On arrival the hotel is covered in scafolding and work men were carrying equipment into the lobby and I was concerned, however, after an easy check-in we given the keys to the room and were pleasently surprised. We had a room on the 7th floor, the room was small, but after unpacking and storing the suitcases away my husband and I had plenty of space to move about the room. The bed was very comfy, air con worked well and plenty of storage too, there was a tv and radio too. The bathroom was clean and the shower was great. The view from the window was overlooking roofs of the attached block, but we didnt go for the view from the hotel room. There was not a safe in the hotel room, they have a 2 key safe area behind reception which is free to use. The room was cleaned well and there were enough pillows and towles. We did not eat the $10 breakfast as there are planty of local deli's with good rates. There are no tea/coffee facilities in the rooms, however there is a lounge in the ground floor with free tea/coffee facilities for guests. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly for the duration of our stay. The building work (a new penthouse on the top floor) that was being undertaken was only noticed by us after 8.30am when they were drilling something and once we got in the lift and the carpet had been removed (guessing to transport building material) but it was not an issue for us at all. The hotel is located 5 mins from Times Square and next to a subway station. The Rockafellar centre was a 10-15 mins walk and the Empire State Building 25-30 mins walk, the subway links to the main stations and there is a great shuttle train from Grand Central Station to Times Square and it is a 5 min walk to the hotel, or you can get on a train to the subway to the hotel. All in all a good hotel, clean, well located hotel in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: AnnoyingDad
Reviews.Content: Not luxurious, but a good place to stay. Perfect location in the theater district. Pleasant and very helpful desk staff. Room was clean, air conditioning worked fine, slept well. Good sushi restaurant off the lobby. By far the lowest price I could find (through a travel site) for a room with two double beds in that area. Didn't eat at the $10 continental breakfast. Only real minus is that housekeeping didn't leave enough towels when the room was made up, and we had to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, perfectly functional and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: hellodooley
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant when I looked at some of the review on here, but was running out of options. Was very pleased I booked here. Amazing location. Staff were friendly (loved the "will be with you in a moment" I got from receptionist while I was waiting behind another customer. 10 points for that customer service). Very speedy check in and check out (usually a pain in the neck at most hotels), clean room. Noisy air con (big deal - cool the room down and turn it off), big comfy bed, and speedy internet. Perfect. Would recommend to friends, and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Stirling48
Reviews.Content: I took a short trip to New York with my teenage son in early July. Let's face it . . .if you are on holiday in NYC, you aren't going to spend a lot of time in your room. This hotel has really small rooms but we were only there to wash and sleep. It is directly across the street from the Gershwin Theatre and down the street from a subway station. The Winter Garden theatre is just down the street. The location is a very, very short walk to Times Square. We arrived mid-morning after a red-eye flight but the staff kindly checked us in and upgraded our room. The air conditioning worked. The hotel restaurant seemed very busy. I would stay there again on my next trip to New York. If you are looking for something fancy, this is not the place for you. If you aren't picky and just want a rest stop in between shows and shopping, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again Without a Doubt”
Reviews.Author: FabEleven
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Thank You Erin for arranging restaurant accommodations for our large group of 11 soon after our arrival late in the evening!! Yes, rooms are small but clean. Bathroom is small but workable, was clean and the fixtures worked well without a problem. No bed bugs either which you hear many NYC hotels have - we checked our rooms immediately upon arrival to the rooms and was very relieved not to find any. Our group was in NYC as tourists and did not spend much time in our rooms. The window air conditioner worked fine and cooled the room and yes was noisy as you would expect one to be - it felt good after being out and about in 96 degrees. One room in our group the air conditioner did not work and the staff was very accommodating to move the girls to a different room which turned out to be a bit larger and the air worked great. Agree the elevators are very slow but it beat taking the stairs after a long day of walking around the city. Not one of our group of 11 had any complaints. We would stay there again. It's location is fabulous as it seems to be in the center of alot of attractions,plays, tour buses, shops and restaurants. Thank You for the memorable stay in NYC. We loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for my NYC visit”
Reviews.Author: Original_Kimber
Reviews.Content: I already knew before booking my hotel for the trip that rooms, apartments etc were on the small side. This room was bigger than my cruise cabins and had everything we needed. Air conditioner worked very well and the shower was great. The location just couldn't be beat and the hotel staff couldn't have been better. For my first visit to New York City I couldn't have picked a better place to stay and am already in the works of planning another trip in which we will definitely book the Amsterdam Court again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Room was fine - don't be put off by what you read on here!”
Reviews.Author: TheLostScot
Reviews.Content: Just back from my first trip to NYC and I stayed at the Amsterdam Court Hotel. The hotel was absolutely fine - no problems at all. It literally is round the corner from Times Square, the subway is about 50 yards away (which is great when you are in lower Manhattan for example, completely knackered and you know that your hotel is only a subway ride away!). I couldn't hear a thing at night, slept well, room was small but trust me you don't go to NYC to spend the time in your hotel room right? The staff at the reception were a great help and friendly. Please if you have booked this hotel and are worried about reviews, don't! Get excited because you're about to have the time of your life, quit worrying - this hotel is completely fine. It is so close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: VAMDDC
Reviews.Content: The room was horrible--I don't mind a small room in NYC, but this one had a horrible odor, like mold. The bed was hard as a rock, the furniture falling apart and the room could barely accommodate two people and luggage. Never again. Only plus was location.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: LucyLovesPatrick
Reviews.Content: stayed 6 nights. Great location. Rooms are absolutely tiny, nearly had to stand in hall while husband got dresses!! Got used to it and didnt take on notice in the end. Bar quite expensive and resturant is sushi and chinese. Staff couldnt be more helpful. Would return again, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: journosarah
Reviews.Content: Having booked our accommodation around five months before our stay, we assumed everything would be planned on the hotel's part. However, when we arrived we were told there were only single rooms left for the first night of our stay, and that if it was too small we could "come down in the morning and see if there are any rooms available then". I'm aware that New York hotels generally aren't that spacious, but this place was tiny! An absolute disgrace! Our suitcases were blocking the door, the bathroom was so small that the door had to be left open for some air, and the shower sprayed everywhere but where it was supposed to. Plus, the ironing board was the length of my partner's shirt and could only stay on the bed, as there was no other surface in the room to iron on. The next day we got the room we originally booked... which looked nothing like the photos! The air-conditioning worked like a fan, the window didn't lock, the middle of the front of the toilet was blocked off by a wall, so I found myself sitting diagonally across the seat. The power point didn't work and staff did not even attempt to get it fixed (even though the said they would). Also, the elevator was slow, unpredictable, and was sometimes out of order. And the Japanese/Italian fusion restaurant inside was more of a sushi place than anything else. I could go on forever about the downsides of this hotel but to add a positive - it was very conveniently located, about a five-minute walk from Times Square. My advice - don't let a shoddy hotel ruin a holiday in a gorgeous city. Spend a bit of extra money and get something decent.

Reviews.Title: “It was horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: ericramer
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. The room was ridiculously small with two double beds. it would have been small with one double bed! For the cost of the room and the set up it was unconscionable that they would offer it. We had to put our suitcases on the floor since there was not a closet or even a dresser. There was a "wardrobe" made of pressboard that was literally falling apart. One of the doors was hanging off and it looked like it might collapse if we put any clothing in it. Then we had to keep picking up our suitcases to move around since there was so little actual floor space. Don't be fooled by their internet photos. We were! I have never written a review and I have stayed in many different types of hotels both good and bad. The fact that I have written one should tell you how bad this place was. Stay clear!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catlover021
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is the location. It's right in the theater district and just up the street from Times Square. The room was small, but this is to be expected in NYC at this price range. The room and bathroom were quite clean, but my feet were dirty after walking on the floor. The air conditioner seemed to be on it's last legs; it was quite loud but hardly cooled the room. Based on other comments, I guess the noise from the air conditioner was good as we didn't hear the sounds from other rooms. The phone did not work for the two nights we were there, though I don't know that the hotel can be blamed for that. We requested a no-smoking room, and it did not smell of smoke, but there was an ashtray in the room. The elevator was very slow. While waiting for the elevator we heard someone knocking and told the person at the desk that people were stuck in the elevator, and at first he seemed to not believe us. We used the stairs after that, and luckily we were only on the third floor, as we had to go downstairs to request things which should have been in the room such as toilet paper. The staff were not friendly and seemed to not want to be bothered. We asked for a taxi and were told we should walk down to the end of the block. We had a wonderful time in NYC but would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Perfect Location, Paper Thin Walls!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahclarke86
Reviews.Content: For us, this hotel was nice because we got it considerably cheaper than any other accomendation in that location. When we arrive they did not have our reservation although we had prepaid, however the staff we very helpful and friendly and resolved the matter while we waited in the bar. The food in the bar is FABULOUS and the bar man Sean was SO NICE! The room itself needs to be updated/painted. Do not be surprised that the rooms are small and according to friends this is what all rooms are like in NY city. We were out late most nights so it was annoying in the morning the maids would let the doors slam and you can hear every tiny conversation going on in the hallways. However booking tours through reception was hassle free they have loads on offer and are friendly and very willing with advice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jeff074
Reviews.Content: We had this hotel booked for us as part of a tour of the USA. Whilst the location, entrance and the staff were great, we were disappointed with the bedroom we had. It was well worn and needed an upgrade all round. Suspect most of the rooms are in a similar state of tiredness. It probably ticks all the boxes for its 3 star grading but I've stayed in much better hotels of this grade in Manahattan.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy - Will not be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: DMPAM
Reviews.Content: Good Points: This hotel is on the cheaper side and with it's excellent location right on the door step of Times Square and Broadway, you can hardly complain. The room was clean and provided what we needed for our stay. Bad Points: If you want a good nights sleep avoid this hotel. Me and my partner are both heavy sleepers and even we could not sleep through the horrendous noise all the showers in the hotel made. This noise being heard during our stay anywhere between 4:30am and 11:00am in the morning. If a shower was being used in a room above or next to ours the room vibrated also. And the noise was that loud on some occasions that we could not even hear the television. (please see videos) With us requesting a non-smoking room we were surprised that we had been placed on a floor with smoking rooms. This meant that on most days when we got back to the hotel we had to put up with a strong smell of smoke both inside and outside our room. And on a few nights this resulted in us having to put towels at the bottom of the door to try and prevent the smoke from getting into our room. And upon returning to the UK i have has to wash everything we took and even the clothes we bought as souvenirs to remove this smell. Overall: The staff were helpful and pleasant, but were under a lot of pressure due to limited staff resources. And the hotel and the rooms did not reflect the price we paid and we were disappointed by the noise and lack of sleep that occured from staying here. We would not recommend staying in this hotel to anyone else and will not be staying there again. Tips: We were not told upon arrival where you obtained the complementary tea and coffee from in the hotel, this is located downstairs past reception and through a corridor located next to the main lift. There is also a pay as you go internet computer located in this room for 25cents a minute $1 for 5 minutes. And even though the hotels website states dial-up internet connection they do also offer wifi at a price.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an affordable price and great location!”
Reviews.Author: DenverCenter
Reviews.Content: I found a great price for Amsterdam Court on TravelZoo and was paying for a weekend extension of a work trip out of my own pocket so I wanted to find the cheapest decent hotel in the Times Square area, and I think I found it! The Amsterdam Court is just fine in every way. I wouldn't spend an excess amount of time in the room, but that's not what most people are in NYC for. The only complaints: I was there over a couple cool spring days and coming in at the end of the day I was fairly chilled, hoping for a warm room. It was very cold in the room and the front desk said the heat only turns on if it's under 50 degrees outside (and it must have been 51 then because it was cool!) Without individual thermostats in the room, I had to just request extra blankets. Also, the walls are thin, so if people are coming in and out of the rooms around you or talking in the hall, you can easily hear it and be woken up. But in general, the room was clean and absolutely sufficient for my needs. I think it might have been a bit tight if I traveled with a companion (the king bed pretty much takes up the whole room) but for the price and location, I would recommend it. It ain't luxury, don't get me wrong. This is for the simple person with few needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Percy1981
Reviews.Content: I was slightly worried when I booked this hotel through LetsGo2 and saw some of the reviews on tripadvisor. Although the room was a bit dated it was clean and not as small as I was expecting. (it wasn't massive but perfectly adequate for two people) We checked in quickly. The only problem we had was that no towels had been left in the room. But after a quick word with reception they were promptly delivered. We had a very pleasant stay and the location was brilliant, just round the corner from Times Square and within easy walking distance of the Rockafeller Centre and Central Park. If we were to come to NYC again (we certainly will!) on the budget we had, we wouldn't hesitate in staying at the Amsterdam Court again.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great service”
Reviews.Author: moondanceranch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after booking a 3 star mystery hotel with Bookit. I thought the hotel was close to everything. I received excellent service from everyone-when I had a concern-it was taken care of promptly. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The room was clean, and small but ok since it was just me and my teenage daughter. The price was fantastic, about the least expensive part of my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT pay much”
Reviews.Author: altrnatif
Reviews.Content: It is a very old building, rooms tiny, hot water EVENTUALLYcomes, elevator on the same schedule... eventually comes, one totally overworked front desk clerk (but very nice) so it takes forever to get checked in/out. Our rooms not ready on arrival however it was before the 3PM posted check in time. I suspect cleaning department understaffed as well. TV was a tiny, old 13" thing but did work OK with cable stations. I would NOT even classify this as a "hotel" it is more of hostel quality. The room was clean, no complaints trere, the front desk person working like a dog to overcome obvious limits on a stingy operation. If you can get a room for cheap, it is a great location in the heart of the theatre district and nead touristy time square. If you expect any kind of hotel-esque quality it will be disappointing, especially if you pay the advertised rack rate. I got a 50% discount online and will still only use this place again as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service, fab price & adequate rooms”
Reviews.Author: scrapmetalzen
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights to take in a show and do a little sightseeing. We had an utterly positive experience. Upon check in Liza, a fantastic employee who deserves a raise gave us maps, coupons, and suggestions. We stayed in room 502, and while it was small (hey it's NYC), it was clean and adequate. Yes it's a little dated and no there isn't a flat screen TV but do you need an HD experience when you're in Manhattan!!? We had one small problem with hot water (this turned out to be user error), however, when I called the front desk they had maintenance at our room within 5 minutes! The location CANNOT be beat. The hotel is flanked by 2 Metro lines ( the C/E and the 1), across the street from the Gershwin ("Wicked"), walking distance to times square, top of the rock, radio city music hall, MOMA, and more. We ate at Natsumi, the Japanese restraunt in the hotel, and it was fantastic, we also dined at Azalea (across the street in the same building as "Wicked") which was beyond amazing. But my favorite discovery was the Majestic Delicatessen Cafe on the corner of 50th and 7th, amazing Cannoli’s and pastries, great sandwiches, great breakfast (from bagels to fruit)....I loved this place!! As far as the Amsterdam Court goes I would stay here a million times over, the location is fantastic and the rooms are fine. If you’re looking for a mchotel room with a huge TV and a bathroom you can throw a party in this might not be the place for you. But if you’re looking for an economical place that serves its purpose and has a FAB location, I suggest the Amsterdam Court.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Choice”
Reviews.Author: geobryce
Reviews.Content: Great little Hotel I was a bit worried after reading the reports on here but all was well when we checked in the staff were very pleasant and helpful and can even source tickets for sold out shows for you "if you need them" The room was comfortable with a queen size bed shower and bath and storage space for our clothes and bags we also had a beureu with a TV aircon and heating the room was tuned down daily and everything was clean and tidy the only gripe I can give you is the noises from the heating system at 3 in the morning was a pain to say the least, although this only really bothered us on one occasion the rest of the time it was fine.I have read some people complaining about room sizes and I cant rely see what there is to complain about ? lets face its not like you spend any more time than you need to in it> The Location on 50th street is truly amazing you can walk everywhere although the subway station is just on the corner as well as are countless bars and restaurants Overall we spent 5 nights here and all I can say is I would stay here again as the location is wonderful you try and find another hotel at this money in this area you cant the only thing you'll get is a hostel so if you have booked this rest easy and enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: citychick87
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4nights in June 2009. It was a really nice hotel. Room wear clean, small-ish but not unbearably so and had everything we needed except a safe. Staff were polite and friendly. Hotel is located on broadway and 2 seconds from times square. We were at the top of times sq near the hershey store, wintergarden theatre, tkts booth etc. There is a subway station right next to the hotel. Check-in was quick and efficient. The hotel also arranged a shuttle back to Newark Airport for us but i cant rememeber what that cost. If I was to return to New York, as much I liked the Amsterdam Court I'dmaybe opt for the Wolcott. My mum stayed there at the same time as I was in NY and the room wasnt as tredny looking but it was bigger, just as clean and the hotel was literally astones through from the empire state building. I felt my mums hotel was better located and better sized.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for everything!”
Reviews.Author: karn28
Reviews.Content: Room was very small but we expected this from reviews. Room was cosy. View of the fire escape but we saw enough during the day! Didn't have much to do with the staff, but those we talked to where friendly enough. Didn't eat in the hotel, $9.95 each for breakfast, plenty of eateries close by. Times square is round the corner and sub-way is handy too, prime location. Very enjoyable 1st time in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and concierge Liza was the absolute best!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PineappleBabe258
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect location on 50th! Just steps from Times Square! The rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. The only downside was that the rooms are very, very small. However we were going for the city and not our hotel room so it wasn't really a problem. Some of the receptionists at the front weren't that helpful when we first checked in and we had problems with the girl that checked us out too but on our 2nd day we met Liza. She was the concierge at the front desk and we simply asked her advice on some local restaurants nearby. She was so friendly and helpful that we talked to her for at least 30 minutes to an hour every day before we left! She was so sweet and always so helpful! She absolutely made our trip what it was! She always recommended amazing restaurants, bakeries, subway routes, hidden spots and even gave us her email in case we had any questions or got lost! I have never had someone be so willing to help!! I would absolutely stay here again for the solely because of Liza.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room”
Reviews.Author: paulomed
Reviews.Content: Dirty room, heater doesn't work well. Concierge with bad education. Room so small. Localization great only .

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Recommended”
Reviews.Author: FlexPointe
Reviews.Content: I was extremely nervous booking this hotel after reading reviews. My friend and I got a great deal on a room here for 6 nights. When we arrived we were upgraded to a room with two double beds. The room was nicer than I expected. Older, yes but great for the location and what we paid. The bathroom could use an update but it was really fine. Water pressure/temp got funky during prime hours. No issues with bedbugs or anything... The best part of the hotel is its right across from the Gershwin Theatre where wicked is playing. Great location for trying to win lottery tickets to see the show.

Reviews.Title: “Central to most locations to visit in NYC”
Reviews.Author: maxine40uk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good location for Times Square and for most other locations youd want to visit in NY. Room size was good quite big in fact as most reviews say rooms in NY are too small, ours was grt size with two wardrobes and big bed ! The room was cleaned every day, and new towels ! The staff were friendly and helpful and we were able to book some tours from the reception desk which was a bonus. The only gripe id have is that when we visited the weather was bitter and the room was a bit cold , the radiator came on in the middle of the night and would have been better to be on earlier in the evening ....saying that we asked for a heater and got one and extra blankets so if the room is cold dont be afraid to ask for the heater earlier . Had a fab time in NY and would not hesitate to book again with Amsterdam Court !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location(That's All)”
Reviews.Author: jennylee47
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was very unhelpful, my friend and I requested a twin room,she said she waould put other bed in room(still waiting)1st room was more akin to a cupboard with no window. Then moved to slightly larger room with window facing a wall. True you hardly spend any time there but it isnt cheap. Housekeeping staff were lovely though.

Reviews.Title: “Good once we changed rooms”
Reviews.Author: skibum963
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we were taken to a tiny room which had not been cleaned (despite the bell boy repeatedly telling the concierge that this room would not be big enough given that we had skis with us and also we had specifically requested a larger room because of our large amounts of luggage before we arrived.) Once we found this room was dirty we were taken to an equally tiny room. We woke up the next day to find that there was no hot water in the shower (not what you need when its freezing outside and you've been travelling for 32 hours to get there). Not a good start! From the next night onwards we were given a much bigger room with a much nicer view. We were very happy with this second room and from then on our experience was enjoyable. The location was great being so close to Times Square. After the first night, reception staff were most helpful. There is also free coffee. Internet was slow and expensive which was a bit disappointing. We found it quite ridiculous that this hotel charges the same rate for the tiny room and the much larger room (by NY standards). Stay here if you can get into one of the bigger rooms!

Reviews.Title: “I'm still on the Fence about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peanutfly
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based soley on price. After spending countless hours on the internet looking for a hotel on New Years I chose this one for it's location and it was the cheapest one I could find. Even after I booked it I searched the internet for reviews on it- hoping to convince myself it wouldn't be as bad as everyone says. Well, I came, I saw, I conqoured, and now it's time to write a review on it! The location is excellent. The front desk staff is so/so, the quality of the rooms are so/so, everything after the amazing location, is just so/so. I had the basics, hot water, clean sheets, clean towels.... Would I stay here again?- no. I'll spend the extra money for something nicer. I was suprised with the size of the room- many people complained how incredibly small it was.... well, it's NYC, everything is cramped in NYC, and I thought the size of the rooms were fine. So if your thinking of switching hotels based on the reviews- don't. Unless you want to be pampered in your room during your vacation, the Amsterdam Court will do just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Would happily stay there again on my next visit!”
Reviews.Author: Clairybums
Reviews.Content: After being delayed by almost 3 hours, we didn't arrive until about 1:30am, we were checked in within a few minutes and in bed sleeping by 2am, in room 103. The room was not overly large but then who wants a massive room when you're going to spend hardly any time there? If you're going to spend loads of time in your room you may as well save money and stay at home. We also had a small but well equipped bathroom, nice and cosy. The staff were very helpful with directions and any other queries we had, especially the porter. The maid was lovely too. Nice, down to earth people, just how I like them. Can't stand the big posh hotels with all their pretentiousness and snobbery. Every day we left in a rush leaving our stuff all over the place (well, 7 year old boys are not the tidiest of people) and every evening we arrived back to find everything back in order, the beds made and clean towels ready. What more could we ask? We did have a chuckle at the radiator knocking in the night, my 7 year old thought it was hilarious but it didn't affect our sleep too much and it kept the room nice and warm on the freezing cold nights. We didn't eat there as we wanted to try out as many restaurants and cafes as our time would allow so I don't know what their food was like. We also went to see Wicked at the Gershwin Theatre, literally just across the road. Great as the snow was thick on the ground. We need to leave at 4:30am for JFK Airport and the staff were very prompt getting a car for us at 4:30 on the dot. The porter carried our bags to the car and wouldn't hear of us lugging it out by ourselves. Checked out as quickly as we checked in. Bliss!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and that was it!”
Reviews.Author: Korky16
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was not great, the only positive was it's location which was brilliant. The rooms were so small that we struggled to open the door far enough to get our suitcases in when we arrived. The room was very poorly lit therefore very dark because there was very little natural light as the window was so small and if you did open the curtains fully you got a lovely view of a brick wall. The staff on reception were not overly helpful either. The only time they were was when we were trying to arrange transport back to the airport and they forcefully tried to sell their private transfers which were more expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Brick Wall!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkGoldfish
Reviews.Content: If you want a central hotal at a cheap price, and won't be spending much time in it then this hotel is fine. The bedroom was very small with an outlook on to a brick wall, very hot as well even in October. To be fair it did have an air-con fan in the room which was needed to get rid of the smell of smoke! The bathroom was great though, and fresh towels everyday. Reception staff helpful and friendly, and a great little cocktail bar connected to the hotel. At the end of the day you get what you pay for, and to sight see for 5 days this hotel was fine due to it's great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor room quality”
Reviews.Author: Sillv
Reviews.Content: Pros:: Clean, comfortable bed, great location, nice staff, good price Cons: Smallest hotel room we've ever stayed in which is OK... but you don't have much room to do sit, except on the bed. The room was only as wide as a queen bed with 2 small night stands on either side. So the width was about 8 feet. In the tiny bathroom, we had a hot water pipe which ran from the ceiling to the floor and sat about 1 inch from the toilet seat. That room was like a sauna and there was no way to cool it down...except to open the door. The rooms are dark with a tiny window and a dim lit overhead light.. The problem with the air conditioner is that even in the cold season, the rooms are VERY hot and with the air conditioner not working in any of the rooms (the fan part works) , you will be very warm at night. If you don't mind the thermostat issue and the size of the room doesn't matter, then this hotel will be fine for you to try out. I would only stay there again if I could not find a comparable hotel in regard to location and price.

Reviews.Title: “horrible ny hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: WvRoo
Reviews.Content: very disappointed. we booked a room w/2 doubles for 3 people and they tried to put us in a room w/one king. After much arguing, they switched us. But our room was horrible. Smelly, dirty, ugly, small. Lobby, staircases, elevators all dirty & inadequate. We had a "superior room" & would hate to see the lesser ones. Go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location”
Reviews.Author: Silverfamily
Reviews.Content: The location is just perfect - right on Broadway and very close to Times Square. Yes, the rooms are small - but we knew that from the beginning - and who spents your holiday in NYC in your room - we don`t. Clean - nice beds, fine bathroom and good location - that`s what counts.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice room”
Reviews.Author: GemGemsEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to New York at the end of March/early April this year. After a awful start (Delta cancelled our flight after leaving us waiting at the airport literally all day) we finally got here and were really pleased with our choice of hotel. A very kind American in the UK let us use her mobile to call the hotel to tell them that we would not make it that night and they were great and said it was no problem - we had already paid. They were great when we arrived and got us checked in quick. If you need a taxi or any help they were very obliging and helpful. When we arrived at JFK we got on the airtrain line that takes you out to the city (LIRR) which was easy to use and not expensive. Once we got to the subway station we were a wee bit unsure and had been planning to walk but we got chatting to a chap on the LIRR and he said he was going in the same direction as us and said it was a fair walk so best to take the subway. He very kindly helped us buy tickets out of a machine (we got a 10 trip ticket I think) and off we went. Once we got to our destination (he indicated which was our stop but you can see it clearly if you get a good map - we used the lonely planet guide for getting about when we were there) we just walked up the stairs and we were at the corner of the street for the hotel. We actually managed to walk past the hotel as the entrance is quite small and the signage is discrete. If you see the next subway station (next to Subway the sandwich place) you have gone too far if you have come up at the top corner - can't now recall which avenue end the subway station is that we came up. A quick walk back along and you'll find it though and you should be able to see a theatre to your right if you have your back to the buildings. The hotel is fantastically located. The subway stations (there are 2 on the street one at the corner and the other about halfway down the street) are close, there is a Subway, Starbucks not far (if you take milk in your tea/coffee ask them not to fill it too high as they seem to fill them right to the top over there). There is also a dunkin donuts, tads brolied steak (my boyfriend loved this place) and a KFC. Times Square can be seen if you come out of the hotel, walk along to your right and then turn 90 degrees to your right. The room itself was relatively small but hey it was £100 a night and we were in central New York - you're not exactly there for the room! The bed was comfy, there was a TV and a small bathroom. The shower pressure was good and tolietries were provided. The room was cleaned each day and fresh towels provided. We were really very happy with the room. The room didn't have much of a view but we really didn't think this was important. The only gripe would be that the bathroom floor tended to flood from the water from the shower so we just put a towel down. Can walk to all the main attarctions very easily from here (which we did for the first 4 days) and then our feet were killing so we started taking the subway instead! We saw lots of people on our flight buying new shoes over there as you do alot of walking!! We went on 2 tours - the Sex and the City tour and a New York bus tour. The Sex and the City tour was ok but not really anything special but the New York bus tour was great - will get my other half to tell me who we went with for that as it was excellent and would recommend. We did most of the major attractions whilst there and found the hotel to be a perfect base.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: donniebeez
Reviews.Content: 1 night in this hotel in the theater district proved not to be enough. Wish we could have stayed longer. Rooms are small, but up to date. Clean and comfy. Great staff, snappy little lobby. And, located right near the subway, times square and lots of broadway theaters. We will stay here again when we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: kammil
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ridiculously overpriced. The area, being close to Hell's Kitchen and its great selection bars/restaurants etc, is probably the only positive thing to mention. The staff is just "ok", the rooms are SO SMALL I could not believe, literally!! I have never slept in a room of this size in my entire life. (like staying in a box) I would never come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Very helpful staff...especially the door man”
Reviews.Author: carina1704
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just stayed at the amsterdam court hotel.........After reading the reviews we were a little worried after booking through expedia. When we got there, we pleanstly suprised. what do people expect from a budget hotel in new york. Our room was clean and big enough for the 2 of us. Our room was cleaned everyday and towels changed. Free coffee was a bonus in the lounge. the reception staff were very helpful with tips on where to go and gave us directions and discounts to certain attractions. You are so close to times square and all the theatres and start of the bus tours(which u should take with GRAY LINE. on the same street is radio city. we found a great bar called 230-fifth rooftop garden. You must go amazing views of the city(all lit up) especially empire state builing. On our journey home we booked a shuttle bus through the hotel when it did not arrive the doorman was very helped, he rang the company to complain and then booked us a limo which the hotel paid the extra dollars to get us to the airport. THANKS.. overall we loved our stay in NEW YORK and would stay at this hotel again. For the price u pay u can not be disapointed. U only sleep in your room at night unless your sad. AAAAAA+

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Friendly Staff in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bostonBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner had read all the bad reviews on Amsterdam Court before leaving on our trip so were somewhat dubious when we arrived. We were checked in by Liz who was extremely friendly she gave us a nice spacious room and lots of advice on where to eat and night life in the area, her knowledge of the city was fantastic. Our room was a good size by NY standards, the only thing I would say is check your air con works because if it doesn't the rooms get extremely hot. Housekeeping came in everyday and our room was always clean and tidy when we got back. Reception were always happy to help with enquiries we had and I really have nothing bad to say about the place. As far as we are concerned we got exactly what we paid for and I would definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: CraigKAustralia
Reviews.Content: Beware of the "Sorry Sir but we've had to place you in a small room (Cell Block 401) as some of our rooms have been water damaged" [--] story. Couldn't open more than one suitcase at a time and the staff were rude and arrogant. A really poor start to our NY visit. You have to insist that they change you to another room - don't back down and make them commit! The location is excellent but I would not stay there again as I'd rather pay a little more than stay in this dump. Don't get me wrong, my expectations were too presumptuous but this was appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptively nice lobby”
Reviews.Author: rew123
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is in a great location for first time visitors to New York, I found it generally disappointing. Upon arrival we were moved for our first night to a sister hotel due to flooding in some of the bedrooms. This was described as one of their 'Five Star Rooms' in the Ameritania hotel, but was in fact very basic and not very well finished. Staff at reception in this hotel were not very friendly. When we returned to the Amsterdam Court the next day staff at reception were slow and not very polite. Door staff however were very polite and helpful. Our room was fairly small, which I understand is to be expected for the price and location of this accommodation. There was virtually no daylight in our room as it was at the lowest level of a lightwell. There were no towels in our room when we arrived and when we requested them we were told that they were in the laundry and wouldn't be ready for 'a while'. There was graffiti on the bedside table and I felt that our room in general did not equate to photographs of rooms shown on Hotels.com or on the hotels own website.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mberry77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the start of March 09, it snowed on the first day. I found the reception staff not very friendly and not very helpful considering there was a mix up with the booking. The hotel was fairly modern. The room was large and spacious, radiators didnt heat up very well and the mattress was awful. The room wasnt cleaned very well during the stay but the beds were made. The shower in the bathroom was poor. The location of the hotel was fantastic as it was just 2 minutes walk from time square, its literally just round the corner so bring your ear plugs! The complimentary coffee was good.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, lovely rooms, great price and locate”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaAec
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 5 nights in July 2009. when we arrived we were told we had two single beds instead of a double bed for the first night and then they would change us. but our room actually had two double beds and was a lot bigger than expected. i had read alot of other reviews about the rooms being small but if you are travelling to new york you dont spend a lot of time in the room. we would often come back to the hotel in the afternoon for a little rest and then get ready to go out again. the hotel is perfer for this as the location is great- right near times square and a subway station. only a 10 minute walk to central park as well. the rooms were cleaned everyday and i never had a problem with the bathroom. this place is perfect and very affordable for a nice hotel in new york in that locate.

Reviews.Title: “absolute worst room, customer service, (photos included)”
Reviews.Author: vmcguire
Reviews.Content: The location was great but I'd rather stay somewhere else and pay a few extra dollars. Don't be fooled by the nice air conditioned lobby. Ask to see a room and sit in it until you are satisfied with the temperature before you sign anything. We booked two rooms-both of which had faulty air conditioners. We complained the first night..and every night thereafter.The "engineer" came to fix it and after taking off the cover and rattling it around a bit told us it was fixed and left. It was not fixed and didn't cool the room at all. The tub didn't drain properly and we had to shower standing in 4 inches of water. They moved us to another room with a king bed instead of two queens. This A/C worked, so we opted to keep this room. The other room had hair on the sheets (not talking head hair here- see photo). They brought us clean sheets but since the cleaning staff went home at 7 (it was 9) they left them on the floor outside the door for us to change. The sink was dirty (see photo) The lights are so dim you can barely see to put on makeup. There is one tiny shelf for toiletries, and barely enough room to walk around the bed. The halls always smelled of smoke. The elevator was slow. Wifi will cost you an extra $15 a day. Only thing free is the coffee if you make it past the bouncer guarding the $10 Continental breakfast. There was one helpful desk staff who got the manager on the phone. He actually accused us of trying to get our money back when all we wanted was a cool room. He was kind enough to give us $50 off the first night, BFD- the bill was $1600+. If you make the mistake of staying here, room 302 has an A/C that works. Room 324 does not. If you need to complain, ask for the manager, his name is Robert, not that it will do you any good but I will get some satisfaction knowing you are waking him in the middle of the night. Direct quote from him-I kid you not.... "for future reference, you should complain to a manager not the front desk."

Reviews.Title: “i've stayed at a nicer motel 6”
Reviews.Author: ejohnson913
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst hotel experience i've ever had. We were planning a somewhat budget trip and came across this hotel on travelocity. We were not expecting anything too extravagant, and we were very pleased with the location and lobby. When you get beyond the lobby -game over! We booked two rooms -neither of which the air conditioner worked. We were able to move one of the rooms...and it was a little cooler. My 65 year old mother had to pull her luggage up three flights of stairs because the service was so terrible. The elevator was broken and no one was willing to help. Right before bed, we noticed hair (not from one's head) on our pillows. When we called the front desk, we were told the house keeper left at seven. Someone did bring us some clean towels though...even though we requested sheets. After telling them we needed sheets, they brought them put them on the floor in front of the door, knocked, and left. We put our new sheets on ourselves. Our sinks were dirty and the toilet had a ring around it. The rooms are smaller than a cruise ship and there is no room for even a suitcase. If you're a woman, I do not recommend staying here just based on the lighting. It is impossible to apply makeup in the room without looking like a clown upon leaving. I have never been so dissatisfied in my life.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: nyladies
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with 4 women. we picked the hotel because of the inexpensive price and location. The location is really good, but that is the only good thing. We booked two superior rooms with double beds.When we arrived in the middle of the day there was nobody there to help with our luggage, so we did it all ourselves. Both air conditioners were awful. we complained on the first night and they were able to change our room to one with a king bed. The other double room had hair(?) all over the bed. we called the front desk and they brought sheets and laid them on the floor outside and knocked on the door and left. the rooms were dark, cramped, dirty, and the maids smoked in the supply closet all day. We had to request that the toilet be cleaned after we had been there for three nights. We requested towels we never got. the service was pathetic. the only time the staff even spoke to us was to try to sell us a private car ride to the airport. I did finally complain so much that they allowed me to speak to the manager on the phone, I guess he is either hiding in his office or not on the premises. He was rude and unhelpful. he actually yelled at me on the phone. Do not make the same mistake we did. Go anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: eddieecat
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget then this is the hotel for you. The only thing that you get is a room and a basic breakfast. However, the rooms are tiny and there is not enough room for two grown adults. We just slept in the room and went round New York in the day. The rooms are clean though and of an appropriate standard. Not sure if I would stay there again though as the size of the rooms did let it down. However, if you want a central location for a cheap price then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but wasted!!”
Reviews.Author: sanCyprus
Reviews.Content: We spent 15whole nights at that hotel! The room was so tiny and dark even with a small window. At first we thought that there was no bathroom (it was behind the door)! We were lucky that we had warm water for shower..and the only reason we hold out was because we were out all the time! Don't expect good cleaning just the minimum but soon you'll notice that the room is full of dust...Don't be drifted by the photos that show only the renovated restaurant and entrance..and not to mention the unthinkable price of 2 mojitos at their bar $31 total when they advertise $9 each!You can eat and drink in nice places with this price! The only good thing was the location nothing else!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: allynator2096
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequesnt NYC traveller, usually for day trips, but this for for a weekend away. I had gotten a good price on this hotel, so I was expecting the room to be very small (but who goes to NYC to stay in the room anyway?) Checkin actually went pretty smooth. We got to the room, which was literally just a bed and a TV with a view of an alleyway (not recommended for the claustrophobic) After dropping off our bags, we went out. This hotel was located about 2-3 blocks from Rockefeller Center and across the street from the Gershwin Theatre and the Circle in the Square Theatre so in fact it was a really great location. After coming back a few hours later we realized our room was pretty hot even though we had turned on the AC full blast when we left. Called the front desk & they sent up a repairman who said the AC was broken and couldn't be fixed til morning, but opened the window for us. Gee thanks! So I went down to the front desk & had them change our room because I did not want to sleep in that sweat box all night. After swithicng to a new room (slightly bigger, w/ a better bathroom and nicer view- but still as small as a walk in closet) we were in bed when at about 11pm the door busts open. The hotel had booked someone else into the same room and given them a key. So after being extremely shaken up I tried to call the front desk only to discover that the phone was broken. So at around 11:30 had to get dressed and walk down to the front desk to explain the problem. They were "very sorry" but that was about it. So the next morning we are awaken by a repairman at 8:30 (even though there was a do not disturb sign on the door) wanting to fix our phone. We sent him away and since we were now up, went down to the front desk who said they would move our room again if we wanted. The front desk wasn't rude or anything, but wasn't really sorry that all these things kept happening. We left the next day, making our displeasure known when we checked out. When we stay in a cheap hotel in NYC again, it will not be this one. This was by far one of the worst places I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Court”
Reviews.Author: hippiechicken
Reviews.Content: Tiny room that smelled funny. I'm not sure if it was smoky or just old. But for $100 a night, couldn't beat the location!! The staff was always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room & affordable prices”
Reviews.Author: YpsiJoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid-June and it was just what we were looking for: a clean, affordable room near Times Square. It's location on 50th between Broadway & 8th gives quick & easy access to Metro Lines that easily connect you to the city. We always walked to Times Square a few blocks South, just to soak it in. There's plenty of food option near Times Square, but also good places on 8th near 50th. Also, there's some Walgreen/CVS type stores nearby. We didn't eat at the restaurant here, but we did visit the bar and we loved the unique mixed drinks! We will certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great service at this hotel very central to all attractions yet quiet”
Reviews.Author: 4inny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location 10 mins from central park, times square. The room was cleaned every day with lots of fresh towels, good shower, iron and hair dryer. We had a superior room which was a great size. The hotel is quiet at night and has a restaurant attached to it. New York is a great city with amazing museums- Frick, Moma,we went to see great plays which we had booked in advance, great places to eat East side,greenwich village, meatpacking district. Although the boat ride to the Statue Of Liberty is very touristy to the skyline is quite breath taking.

Reviews.Title: “value,friendly staff,and wonderful location !!!!”
Reviews.Author: throb1603
Reviews.Content: Having been in NYC 5 (or is it 6?) times in the last 3 years,my wife and I reckon we have found the best value hotel in midtown nyc! Friendly and efficient staff,sensible and affordable breakfast,all day coffee or tea (after all the shopping) and easy access to everything you have ever seen on TV. Turn right,from front door -Times Square ,Broadway ,St Pats Cathedral.Bloomingdales,Tiffanys,Saks and more ,allwithin 5-10 mins walk! Macys,Empire State Building,Madison Square Garden-no more than 20 mins away!!!! (have you spotted the common theme yet?????) Admittedly not the greatest hotel in the world but LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION !!!!! ps try Latitude Bar on 8th Ave and 48th st (turn left out of hotel to 8th Ave,left again and 200 yards downtown) Super bar,wonderful staff and half price drink for the ladies on thursday nites+happy hours that last for 4 hours !!!! (only in nyc)!!! Enjoy, and see you in september xx

Reviews.Title: “So dimly lit it's impossible to read in your room even with all lights on.”
Reviews.Author: nekomau
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel once before and had a great experience. This time, not so much. First, they didn't have our reservation, luckily I had printed out our confirmation and we were admitted (joy). I was traveling with a co-worker so needed 2 doubles, instead they put us in a room off the lobby that had one double bed and absolutely no light. The window looked onto a close brick wall and even when we turned on all lights, it was so dim there was no way to read what was in front of you. We couldn't stay in that room, then in a comedy of errors, they had us look at 3 other rooms to move to that all had people already checked into them. Ultimately, they gave us another reservation's room. It also was extremely dim. They moved us again the next day to a room with 2 doubles and it also was so dim that neither of us could read with all the lights in the room on. I think the problem is that the main light fixture is covered with fabric so the light can't get out. The final problem was that the room we finally landed in had a construction crew jackhammering directly outside starting each day at 8am. It was another property, but made it impossible to be in the room during any daylight hour. Just too many problems to make this a future option to stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL. Avoid staying here.”
Reviews.Author: TorontoYoung
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have found a bad hotel through Trip Advisor. Check-in was a painful 30+ minute process. The staff are useless. My room was a converted storage closet on the ground floor. There was no window in my room, it was filthy, the toilet didn't work, there was no soap in the room, and there was no hot water at all. Called for a wake up call... they couldn't even handle doing that. My colleague was in a room with a single bed that hadn't been cleaned (there were dirty band aids in the garbage). Felt unsafe and dirty. The best part of the trip was leaving. Will absolutely never stay here again, and hope nobody else ever has to.

Reviews.Title: “What a "Central Perk!"”
Reviews.Author: MrMickR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are just back from New York after spending 5 nights at the Amsterdam Court Hotel. This hotel is hard to beat for everything and I would recomend to anyone or group. We arrived into Newark airport and decided to take the bus to Port Authority station which cost us $15 each (cheaper that the $80 for a taxi) - what I liked about this hotel was that it was close to public transport too. We managed to walk (and in the rain) with 2 cases for 8-10 min up 8th Ave to 50th street where the hotel was. We were welcomed and quickly shown to our rooms - 7th floor. Ok the rooms are small, but this is NYC and room time was not goin to be important. There was enough room for all our clothes - no problems.
